excerpts: We got the corn cheese and it was so flavorful you have no idea.
I recommend this place 15/10!
corn cheese.author: Diamond K.
corn cheese.review: We all went to sf for the weekend for a birthday and I always wanted to try Korean food with cheese. We stayed at an air bnb down the street from here that's how we ended up finding it. Our servers were so nice and attentive to us the entire time. Even the manager came and talked to us with recommendations for soju. The food was unbelievable! I had the seafood ramen and it was sooooo good I didn't even have time to take a pic of it. The mussel in it was so fresh I can still remember how it tastes. We got the corn cheese and it was so flavorful you have no idea. I recommend this place 15/10!

excerpts: The kids love the sweet potato fries and corn cheese.
I mean who doesn't like fries and cheese?
The fries were hot and the corn was full of yummy gooey cheese!
We also ordered the Garlic Chicken, Kalbi, Miso Pork Belly, chilled squid salad, Vegetable Basket, japchae, Korean style pancake and the "old" Kimchi.
The house made Kimchi was delicious but the best were the wings.
According to everyone, they were seasoned perfectly and were finger licking good.
My family and friends said they can drink the refreshing citron soju and eat the garlic chicken wings all day!
Being a vegetarian, I ate most of the mushroom japchae and enjoyed the fresh veggie wraps that I made with the veggie basket.
The citron soju was indeed refreshing.
We also tried the peach soju and all of us prefer the citron soju.
For dessert, we had vanilla and Strawberry mochi ice cream and green tea cheesecake.
The service was very attentive and we didn't feel rushed even though the restaurant was full.
It was a scrumptious meal and we'll certainly be back!
corn cheese.author: Robert T.
corn cheese.review: Hwaro is a relax, modern and hip Korean restaurant with delicious food.  Came here with my family and friends and we really enjoyed ourselves. The kids love the sweet potato fries and corn cheese. I mean who doesn't like fries and cheese? The fries were hot and the corn was full of yummy gooey cheese! We also ordered the Garlic Chicken, Kalbi, Miso Pork Belly, chilled squid salad, Vegetable Basket, japchae, Korean style pancake and the "old" Kimchi. The house made Kimchi was delicious but the best were the wings. According to everyone, they were seasoned perfectly and were finger licking good. My family and friends said they can drink the refreshing citron soju and eat the garlic chicken wings all day!  Being a vegetarian, I ate most of the mushroom japchae and enjoyed the fresh veggie wraps that I made with the veggie basket. The citron soju was indeed refreshing. We also tried the peach soju and all of us prefer the citron soju. For dessert, we had vanilla and Strawberry mochi ice cream and green tea cheesecake. The service was very attentive and we didn't feel rushed even though the restaurant was full. It was a scrumptious meal and we'll certainly be back! We want to try the hangover soup and the Korean ramen.

excerpts:
Corn cheese (5/5)
8.
corn cheese.author: Su Lin Y.
corn cheese.review:
This just might be my new favorite Korean restaurant in San Francisco! I used to frequent 707 Sutter and Cocobang but this place definitely hit the spot.

I've been pretty disappointed by corn cheeses at other Korean places around here but THIS was so good. Previous corn cheeses just left me thinking: "I could do this better on a random skillet with string cheese at home". But this one--we wiped it out in a few minutes. The corn wasn't too soggy or mushy, with a generous serving of cheese, and topped with tempura crunch, which was actually an amazing addition. 

We were a table of 4 but ordered SO much even the waiter thought we over-ordered. But with eyes significantly bigger than our bellies, we were prepared for take-out.

We ordered:
1. Topokki with cheese (4/5 stars)
2. Kalbi (5/5)
3. Seafood pancake (4/5)
4. Hot stone bowl ramen with spam (4/5)
5. Half-half wings (4/5)
6. Kimchi Jiggae (kimchi stew) (5/5)
7. Corn cheese (5/5)
8. Taco trio (5/5) (if you're sharing this... GRAB THE BULGOGI PIECE FAST) 

The portions were really generous so much so that we had to drag an extra table over to put all the food (we eventually also filled that table). Kalbi came with super fresh lettuce and all the necessary additive sauces and pastes. I loved everything and went home with my Korean craving cured and a very happy belly. I'll be back!!!!

excerpts: Corn cheese = surprisingly good.
(I was expecting some awful rendition of corned cream.)
corn cheese.author: Fannie S.
corn cheese.review:
Food = okay.

Kimchi fried rice with pork = bland. We were all looking forward to this dish, and were so disappointed by it. It was lackluster in flavor and spices.  $13.00.  

Hamul pajeon = good. $16.00. 

Fried wings (1/2 and 1/2) = good. Original & sweet-spicy. This was our favorite item. $17.00.

Corn cheese = surprisingly good. (I was expecting some awful rendition of corned cream.) $7.00

Pork belly with lettuce wraps = meh. Not what I expected at all. $21.00.

Hot barley tea = $2.00.

Coke = $2.00.

Beer = $4.00.

Service = friendly. 

Seating = mostly 2-tops and 4-tops, and a few tables with bar stool seating. I got us reservations but it was fairly quiet on a Thursday evening.

Prices = moderate to expensive. $88.97 for dinner for 3, with minimal leftovers. 

It's great to have a Korean fusion joint in this neighborhood but I hope they kick it up a notch, because the flavors were just not there for us.

It would be alright if paired with vegi wrap

Japchae - great taste

Corn cheese -
corn cheese.author: Ada L.
corn cheese.review:
UberEATS review: Ordered from them twice. First time they missed the Bulgogi, the second time they missed the wraps on all my barbecue items. Unacceptable service if you were to do delivery.  

Items are on the pricier side and tbh not worth it. 

Hangover soup - expected to have more soup... the veg and meat are overwhelming

Kalbi - small portion for $27, otherwise it's tastes good

Miso pork belly - salty. It would be alright if paired with vegi wrap

Japchae - great taste

Corn cheese - They put tempura crumb and tomato sauce... meh

Half and half Chicken wings - like the sweet sauce. They do put big chunk of garlic. Not impressive. 

End note: spent too much on a mediocre restaurant. not coming back.

excerpts: We had the pork belly, fried chicken, the corn cheese dish and lots of pineapple soju!
It was such a great meal!
I can't wait to go back!
So glad it's in the neighborhood!
Too bad it's only open for dinner
but hopefully they will open for lunch in the near future!
Great vibe!
Looking forward to trying other items on the menu!
corn cheese.author: raquel t.
corn cheese.review: Came here on a Friday night with some friends! The service was great and the food was spectacular! We had the pork belly, fried chicken, the corn cheese dish and lots of pineapple soju! It was such a great meal! I can't wait to go back! So glad it's in the neighborhood! Too bad it's only open for dinner but hopefully they will open for lunch in the near future! Great vibe! Looking forward to trying other items on the menu!

excerpts: The Korean bar food is tasty (corn cheese,  and did someone say Korean fried chicken?!?), plus they have more traditional BBQ (not cook at the table bit sizable portions on a sizzzzzzzling plate), dishes and soups.
And they have their beer/wine license now so get some soju!!
corn cheese.author: Sig N.
corn cheese.review: If you're on the south side of the city, craving Korean food/BBQ, and don't feel like schlepping to the Richmond then come to Hwaro! It's more traditional than Namu but still has some California flair. The Korean bar food is tasty (corn cheese,  and did someone say Korean fried chicken?!?), plus they have more traditional BBQ (not cook at the table bit sizable portions on a sizzzzzzzling plate), dishes and soups. And they have their beer/wine license now so get some soju!!

excerpts: We ordered the kimchi cheese, hangover soup, and fried chicken (half garlic half spicy).
Everything was pretty delicious.
I wish the kimchi cheese came with more chips.
The hangover soup came with plenty of beef .
And the fried chicken came on a hot plate so you can flip the the garlic chicken around and cook the garlic more if you want.
Overall a nice place for a causal dinner and night out with friends.
Service was great and parking wasn't too bad.
kimchi cheese.author: Len L.
kimchi cheese.review: Came here on a Saturday night around 8:30 and there were plenty of tables open.  This place has pretty cool decor and spacious.  We ordered the kimchi cheese, hangover soup, and fried chicken (half garlic half spicy).  Everything was pretty delicious.  I wish the kimchi cheese came with more chips.  The hangover soup came with plenty of beef .  And the fried chicken came on a hot plate so you can flip the the garlic chicken around and cook the garlic more if you want.  Overall a nice place for a causal dinner and night out with friends.  Service was great and parking wasn't too bad.

excerpts:
Others:
- Kimchi cheese:
Okay, I LOVE kimchi, but keep in mind that a lot of their dishes already come with kimchi.
This dish was kimchi-overkill, especially noting that the majority of our dishes had or came with kimchi.
I would pass on this one, and would try their cheese corn instead for some variety.
- Kimchi fried rice: It was good, nothing extraordinary.

kimchi cheese.author: Kris C.
kimchi cheese.review:
Delicious!!! I went with a big group, so I was able to try a good portion of their menu.

Favorites!
- Taco trio: love fusion tacos! These were filled with variations of lettuce, kimchi, bulgogi, spicy pork, and a creamy mayo-based sauce to tie everything together. 
- Garlic pork belly BBQ plate: We were debating between this and the galbi, and I'm so happy we went with pork belly! Tender and flavorful, and went well with the lettuce wraps (wish they gave only lettuce, the cabbage included was odd). I enjoyed the mini trio of sides that came with it (kimchi, cucumber, sauce) to enjoy the pork belly+lettuce with. Highly recommend! 
- Seafood pancake: Although I wish it was a tad bit crispier, this was delicious and made for a wonderful appetizer. Dipping sauce was yummy--I wish it came with more!

Others:
- Kimchi cheese: Okay, I LOVE kimchi, but keep in mind that a lot of their dishes already come with kimchi. This dish was kimchi-overkill, especially noting that the majority of our dishes had or came with kimchi. I would pass on this one, and would try their cheese corn instead for some variety.
- Kimchi fried rice: It was good, nothing extraordinary. Standard kimchi fried rice that didn't have any wow factor for me.
- Garlic fried chicken: The garlic is apparently sweetened with combined sugar, but it just tasted (and definitely felt) like raw garlic to me. I would pass on this one.
- Sweet n' spicy fried chicken: If you like a lot of sauce on your wings, then this might be for you! Personally, I would love to try their regular bare fried chicken instead--the meat itself is indeed crispy and juicy!

I can't wait to come back for more; would love to try their korean ramen and especially the hangover soup that everyone raves about!

excerpts: We ordered kimchi fried rice, taco trio, and rice cake skewers.
We were overly ambitious for ordering the rice cake skewers, but the taco trio and kimchi fried rice were legit.
We were overly ambitious for ordering the rice cake skewers, but the taco trio and kimchi fried rice were legit.
The taco trio is perfect for the indecisive folks since it includes combos of bulgogi, spicy pork belly, and kimchi.
Kimchi fried rice is just delicious any time of day.
taco trio.author: Connie L.
taco trio.review:
We were craving Korean food and the Sunset is just too far away to scavenge for food. We yelped it and came across this random restaurant in the mission - was surprisingly decent.

We ordered kimchi fried rice, taco trio, and rice cake skewers. We were overly ambitious for ordering the rice cake skewers, but the taco trio and kimchi fried rice were legit. The taco trio is perfect for the indecisive folks since it includes combos of bulgogi, spicy pork belly, and kimchi. Kimchi fried rice is just delicious any time of day. I would not say this place is purely Korean, since the food does taste slightly Americanized (like all Asian restaurants in this area), but it was still tasty and filling. 

The restaurant is super spacious and we did not have to wait to get seated (the best of both worlds especially when hungry). I wish they had a food truck some where so I can get these tacos on-the-go!

excerpts: The menu has many items that sounded great and we settled on the taco trio, seafood pancake, and the garlic pork belly bbq.
The food packed a flavorful punch and I would say my favorite dish was the garlic bbq pork belly.
It was more garlic intensive than I was expecting which was great since I love garlic.
I thought the seafood pancake could have been better.
We also had mochi for dessert and they offered six flavors that night.
taco trio.author: Maya S.
taco trio.review:
Our waitress was awesome in walking through the menu and giving us recommendations. She checked on us frequently however towards the end of the meal, it took a while to get the check. 

The menu has many items that sounded great and we settled on the taco trio, seafood pancake, and the garlic pork belly bbq. The food packed a flavorful punch and I would say my favorite dish was the garlic bbq pork belly. It was more garlic intensive than I was expecting which was great since I love garlic. I thought the seafood pancake could have been better. We also had mochi for dessert and they offered six flavors that night. I'd like to come back and try more items including their soups and the dessert korean pancake. 

It's a very modern space. While I was dining, I was trying to recall what was the restaurant previously and I remembered it was a Goldilock's. Hwaro seems like a great addition to the area.

excerpts: From looking through yelp reviews to see what was most popular, we decided to order the taco trio, cheese corn, and Korean ramen with spam and kimchi for two people.
We also ended up getting a bottle of peach soju to go with our meal
Everything turned out to be super yummy and we ended up finishing everything we ordered!
I really enjoyed the Korean ramen, especially on a cold, rainy day.
It's a bit different from the tofu soup at other Korean restaurants with ramen added to it, but I really like the flavoring and the ramen texture here.
I would definitely order this again.
You have the options of adding cheese, spam or kimchi for an additional price -
I believe it was $1/$2 for each item.
The taco trio was super juicy and flavorful!
It has three different kinds of meat I believe
and I enjoyed all of them!
:) i wouldn't mind if there was a little bit less of that orange sauce though
, it was a bit too saucy for me, but that probably varies and I don't mind it too much
so I would definitely order this again.
taco trio.author: Bailey L.
taco trio.review:
I came here on a Saturday around 8-9pm and got seated right away, since they close at 10pm. We got really lucky and found parking right in front! From looking through yelp reviews to see what was most popular, we decided to order the taco trio, cheese corn, and Korean ramen with spam and kimchi for two people. We also ended up getting a bottle of peach soju to go with our meal :) Everything turned out to be super yummy and we ended up finishing everything we ordered! (This doesn't happen a lot because I usually get full really easily) 

I really enjoyed the Korean ramen, especially on a cold, rainy day. It's a bit different from the tofu soup at other Korean restaurants with ramen added to it, but I really like the flavoring and the ramen texture here. I would definitely order this again. You have the options of adding cheese, spam or kimchi for an additional price - I believe it was $1/$2 for each item. We decided to go with just the spam and kimchi since we're already having a lot of cheese from the cheese corn! 

The cheese corn has a nice presentation and tastes pretty good as well! I like how it has the Panko/fried bread crumbs along the sides and some siracha sauce on top. It is not the best cheese corn that I've ever had, but it is pretty good and unique from the other cheese corn dishes I've had at other places. 

The taco trio was super juicy and flavorful! It has three different kinds of meat I believe and I enjoyed all of them! :) i wouldn't mind if there was a little bit less of that orange sauce though, it was a bit too saucy for me, but that probably varies and I don't mind it too much so I would definitely order this again. Maybe next time there will be less orange sauce on it and not drenched like this time! 

I am looking forward to coming back and trying more items on the menu. Maybe the wings next time? And the hangover soup if I do a lot of drinking the night before ;)

excerpts: Taco Trio: love the different varieties of meat in the taco and the kimchee!
taco trio.author: Carolyn L.
taco trio.review:
I was surprised at how delicious this was! I'm not a huge fan of fusion menus, but the dishes here tasted great. The interior has a very modern, hipster flair but the food tastes authentic. One downside is that dishes are pricey and you don't get the typical authentic complimentary side dishes. But some main dishes come with a tiny side of kimchee and pickled cucumbers. 

Bulgogi: really really good! Juicy, flavorful, not too fatty, and fantastic miso dipping sauce. 

Taco Trio: love the different varieties of meat in the taco and the kimchee! Flavors worked well with the tortilla. 

Seafood Pancake: I would've liked it a bit crunchier, but they do give a very generous portion of seafood. 

Kimchee Fried Rice: delicious and very flavorful. Highly recommend!

excerpts:
Taco Trio w/ bulgogi, spicy pork belly, kimchi, lettuce ($8) - 4 STARS
bit.ly/2dp8cqL
A really good value since there were generous amount of tender bulgogi and pork belly but the marinades were both sweet.
taco trio.author: Cherylynn N.
taco trio.review:
3.5 STARS

The Excelsior is an under the radar neighborhood in San Francisco. If you're not a native San Franciscan, you've probably only heard of the area because of Joe's Cable Car Restaurant (now defunct) that was featured on The Food Network. Good riddens with your $20 crappy burger served on a plastic plate, $7 sharing fee, and side of stank face. 

Aside from awesome taquerias, Excelsior's food scene is non-existent until Hwaro soft opened a month ago. The menu is a mix of traditional and fusion Korean dishes (from Kimchi Jjigae to Korean Tacos). Prices are reasonable for SF standards and portions were generous. It's currently BYOB until they get their liquor license so definitely stop by Kukje beforehand and bring in soju and beer. Reservations accepted. 

~ * ~ F O O D ~ * ~
The banchans: kimchi  and cucumber salad were weak which is usually a bad sign for a Korean restaurant but the food turned out pretty decent. I like that they provide you with lettuce wraps upon request and they have purple rice (yay!) but they charge you $2/bowl bit.ly/2dE0nkp. 

*Kalbi: Marinated Beef Short-Ribs (LA cut) w/ banchan, lettuce for wrapping ($25) - 4.5 STARS
bit.ly/2dC2mjY
The table's favorite, the Kalbi was perfectly marinated and grilled. Each savory sweet piece was nicely charred, marbled, and very tender. On par with the Kalbi I've had in the South Bay. 

*Taco Trio w/ bulgogi, spicy pork belly, kimchi, lettuce ($8) - 4 STARS
bit.ly/2dp8cqL
A really good value since there were generous amount of tender bulgogi and pork belly but the marinades were both sweet. A wedge of lime would have been perfect to cut through all the sweetness. 

*Korean Fried Chicken: Half Garlic, Half Sweet-Spicy ($16) - 3.5 STARS
bit.ly/2cNwLL7
We requested half regular and half sweet spicy but received the garlic instead of the regular. The KFC batter is thick and crunchy and the chicken was moist and juicy. It was underseasoned but I prefer that over it being overly salty. The garlic mixture was raw, minced garlic and sugar. It was unappetizingly astringent and cloyingly sweet so we scraped it off. I didn't try the sweet spicy one. Accompanying pickled daikon was great - crunchy and nicely pickled.

Kimchi Fried Rice w/ pork, sunny-side up egg, seaweed ($12) - 3.5 STARS
bit.ly/2d8MMw4
The fried rice was on the bland side since the kimchi was mild and not very fermented, but the perfectly cooked egg with an oozy yolk added a nice, creamy "sauce".

Samgyupsal Gui: BBQ Pork Belly, spicy sauce ($19) - 3 STARS
bit.ly/2cXBRIb
It was a pretty large portion of pork belly but it was chewy and the "spicy" sauce was more sweet than spicy. 

*Haemul Pajeon: Seafood Pancake w/ shrimp, squid, chives ($14) - 2 STARS
bit.ly/2dDYfJb
The pajeon wasn't thoroughly browned and there was too much batter so it was doughy. Squid was chewy and there weren't any shrimp as per the menu. Dipping sauce (soy-vinegar) was good though. 

Kimchi Jjigae: Kimchi Soup w/ tofu, veggies, pork belly ($12)
bit.ly/2dL7k2x
I didn't try any but my friends seemed to enjoy it. 

~ * ~ S E R V I C E ~ * ~
All the servers were green but very upbeat, friendly, and attentive (kept our water glasses full). I brought a birthday cake as a surprise for the birthday girl and the server asked the birthday girl, "Did you want me to bring out your cake, or did you want to save it for another time?" 

FAIL.  

Understandably mistakes happen but going forward, they should pull aside the customer who brought the cake or wait until the customer asks for it. 

Since it was a busy Saturday night and there was a constant flow of customers, it would have been nice if the owner was proactive, pitched in with her staff and/or interacted with customers. Instead, she was having a full, sit down meal with her dining companion at the bar for the majority of time we were there (2.5 hours). Obviously, her restaurant, her rules but it came off unprofessional.

~ * ~ A M B I A N C E / D E C O R ~ * ~
The space is minimalist and hipster. Good for parties of 2-4 and there's two communal tables that fit 6 people each. When we arrived, the ambiance was very upbeat and lively with the pop music that was playing...just as any fun Korean restaurant should be (like Playground, Tonight, The Spot, and Toyose). 

The music soon turned into odd mix of slow, depressing jazz tracks when the owner started having dinner at the bar. Since the music was dampening the mood, my friend's bf kindly provided feedback to one of the servers. She spoke with the owner who changed it for half a track, then changed it back to the slow, jazz music, and returned to dinner with her dining companion at the bar. Again, her restaurant, her rules but she didn't seem receptive to feedback which is unfortunate. 

~ * ~ P A R K I N G ~ * ~ 
Difficult street parking. 

Hwaro is the first and only Korean restaurant in the area serving pretty solid food. Hopefully, they'll pave the way for more restaurants like this to open in the area!

excerpts: My friend and I came and ordered 3 things (which was way too much for us hahaha): 1/2 garlic and 1/2 sweet and spicy chicken, the taco trio, and the hangover soup!
- Fried chicken: loved the KFC here, the batter was thick and crunchy and the wings were huge.
The garlic sauce needs a little work (it's pretty much raw garlic and sugar), but I did like the sweet and spicy sauce (it wasn't spicy at all btw).
- Taco trio: Loved this!!
I love Asian fusion tacos
so we had to order this.
The combo of kimchi, lettuce, and Korean-marinated meat was delish!
They came with a pretty generous amount of meat too.
- Hangover soup: I thought this would be the most underwhelming
but it was actually really good!
The soup was very rich and flavorful and would probably taste good with some rice.
taco trio.author: Tara A.
taco trio.review:
Glad Excelsior/outer Mission is being put on the map finally! Hwaro is a good choice when you want something different, Asian fusion-y, or Korean!

My friend and I came and ordered 3 things (which was way too much for us hahaha): 1/2 garlic and 1/2 sweet and spicy chicken, the taco trio, and the hangover soup!
- Fried chicken: loved the KFC here, the batter was thick and crunchy and the wings were huge. The garlic sauce needs a little work (it's pretty much raw garlic and sugar), but I did like the sweet and spicy sauce (it wasn't spicy at all btw).
- Taco trio: Loved this!! I love Asian fusion tacos so we had to order this. The combo of kimchi, lettuce, and Korean-marinated meat was delish! They came with a pretty generous amount of meat too.
- Hangover soup: I thought this would be the most underwhelming but it was actually really good! The soup was very rich and flavorful and would probably taste good with some rice. The meat was suuuper tender in this soup!

Service was a little weird.. When we asked the waitress about certain menu items, she couldn't even describe them, lol!! Also when we got our receipt to pay with credit card (we split 2 cards), they forgot to include my receipt to sign.. Eh!

I would love to come back and try the pork belly, galbi, or the bugolgi. We saw tables ordering these and they looked great with the lettuce wraps! The lunch bentos also look really good and are nicely priced.

excerpts: One for the Taco Trio.
taco trio.author: Alvin D.
taco trio.review:
There have been many chances where I've been able to eat good ramen. This was not one of them.

The quality of the noodles is instant ramen quality. I'm actually quite confident it was instant ramen.

I added cheese. They gave me a single slice of American cheese.

Incredibly disappointed by the Korean ramen.

2 stars overall. One earned for service passing. One for the Taco Trio.

excerpts: We ordered the French Fries (topped with kimchi), Taco Trio, Kimchi Fried Rice, Japchae, and Kimchi Soup.
The Taco Trio was very flavorful.
It's an appetizer, but I think it's enough to be a meal on
it's own.
Kimchi Fried Rice was pretty good, good amount of spiciness but lacked a bit of salt.
I was not a fan of the Japchae.
I don't eat Korean food often
so I'm not entirely sure what it's supposed to taste like, but the noodle texture was just not that good.
I only had a spoon of the Kimchi Soup and I thought it was extremely sour.
Not sure if that's what it's supposed to taste like, but my boyfriend enjoyed it.
taco trio.author: Lina C.
taco trio.review:
Came here for dinner on a Wednesday night with the boyfriend. We ordered the French Fries (topped with kimchi), Taco Trio, Kimchi Fried Rice, Japchae, and Kimchi Soup. Yes, I know, that's a lot of food for two people! 

The french fries were the first to come. A third way into the fries my boyfriend mentions that these fries remind him of McDonald's fries. He spent the rest of dinner convincing himself (and me) that these fries are old fries (when I say old, I mean fries that have been left out for a few hours) from McDonald's. Everyone knows what leftover McDonald's fries tastes like, and these kimchi fries definitely tasted like that. Don't get me wrong, the fries were pretty delicious (although it would've been better if the fries were waffle fries, so it can hold the kimchi and sauce more)! But the thought that these fries may have been possibly from McDonald's was just so shocking. 

Anyway, enough about the fries. The Taco Trio was very flavorful. It's an appetizer, but I think it's enough to be a meal on it's own. Kimchi Fried Rice was pretty good, good amount of spiciness but lacked a bit of salt. I was not a fan of the Japchae. I don't eat Korean food often so I'm not entirely sure what it's supposed to taste like, but the noodle texture was just not that good. I only had a spoon of the Kimchi Soup and I thought it was extremely sour. Not sure if that's what it's supposed to taste like, but my boyfriend enjoyed it.

excerpts: They have a number of small plates that sound great like the Taco Trio, gyoza, and asparagus because something has to be green.
taco trio.author: Michael C.
taco trio.review:
A new, modern Korean restaurant in the Excelsior playing bossanova? YES!

I was a bit upset when I saw Goldilocks close. I had recently been there and while it was my third favorite Filipino restaurant in Excelsior, they did introduce me to some new stuff.

My mood changed when I saw the sign on the door saying the new place was Hwaro, a Korean restaurant. Excelsior has Filipino, Japanese, Thai, Laotian, Vietnamese, all types of Chinese. But we don't have Korean. 

Let alone one that serves alcohol.

This week they are going through a soft launch - they don't officially open or have a working credit card until 9/5/16 - but are taking customers. The lunch menu is very different from the dinner, which also explains the large break in between.

When I walked in on a Tuesday, there were a few groups eating - and I do recommend coming here in a group or on a date so you can try more. I sat by myself and spent time on the menu. They have a number of small plates that sound great like the Taco Trio, gyoza, and asparagus because something has to be green. 

There are also big plates which are must shares. Three types of KFC (Korean Fried Chicken), kimchee fried rice, seafood pancakes, tonkatsu. They have Korean ramen and a Hangover Soup! 

I went with the sizzling BBQ eel. I love eel, heck I've had eel fried rice directly across the street. The great waitress warned me it was only 6 pieces but that was enough for tonight. Along with it came some lettuce to make wraps, some banchan, and I ordered a side of rice. It was delicious and it will be hard not to order it again.

Or live out a dream and special order a BBQ eel taco.

After finishing up I got to talk to the two waitresses, the owner Ina jamming out to classic bossanova, and the head chef Ryan. They explained some of the backstory, how they will soon be getting three types of Korean beer (including Hite!), shoju, and wine, and that the neighborhood has welcomed them. 

I really like Hwaro and feel it not only adds a culinary option to Excelsior, but adds a more modern option as well. With Rocks Den, Sushi Raw, and now Hwaro, this part of Excelsior is getting some gentrification. Not white people (says the white person), but more gentrifying for Millenials - modern locations with a modern vibe. I don't want the area to be completely changed - I may actually be addicted to Baby's lumpia - but I like that we are getting options to take groups or dates to. Excelsior isn't only for cheap lunch, and Hwaro helps this.

UPDATE: I came over for lunch and got the sweet and spicy fried chicken bento and the pork belly quesadilla. The bento came with side salad, some of the least greasy japchae I've ever had, two dumplings, rice, kimchi and 4 wings covered in sauce. Ask for extra napkins! I definitely got a lot of sauce on my face/beard. The wings were cooked perfectly, and the sauce was both sweet and spicy. Not bad for the amount of food I got.

But the pork belly quesadilla stole the show! I want one right now. Full of delicious pork belly, kimchi, cheese, sauce, and I want to say butter because it was decadent. Still can't wait to bring people here.

Update 9/18: Took two friends here for dinner to finally get a group dinner going. We got:
-Corn Cheese - basically a skillet filled with sweet corn and mozzarella cheese. Two things I love
-Gyoza - I'm a sucker for dumplings
-Rice Cake Skewers - Because it was my birthday, the owner gave these to us on the house, and explained that growing up in Korea, this was one of her favorite street food snacks. We got two skewers with about 5 rice cakes on top, covered in the sweet and spicy sauce from the chicken wings. If you like sweet and spicy, these are really good, a bit chewy. Glad I got to try these!
-Kimchee Pancake - one of my guests doesn't like seafood, which is why we got this. Turns out he also doesn't like kimchee, SMH. This was delicious.
-Kimchee Fried Rice - yeah, my friend didn't have the best meal, but his loss. This was delicious, spicy fried rice with some seaweed which gives it a really interesting flavor. But man that pork belly is so good.

Oh, and for my return trip I was recommended trying the miso pork belly.

Also they have the cleanest bathroom in Excelsior.

excerpts: My friends ordered bibimbap, taco trio, and kimchi fried rice with pork (?), while I ordered tteokbokki with ramen.
I can't speak for my friends' meals, but they all really liked their food.
I also really enjoyed my meal as well!
taco trio.author: Sharon T.
taco trio.review:
My friends and I went to an event and we were seriously super hungry afterwards. We were craving Korean food and had to quickly pick a random place nearby that was open since most Korean restaurants close midday. We eventually found this place that looked really nice from the pictures. 

We arrived to the area and I'm being serious when I say the location was really sketchy and scary. My friend got hit on by an old man, another old man waving at us from above his apartment with a Chucky doll, and there were even boys calling us from across the street. No joke, this all happened just walking 2 blocks down to the restaurant. I know this doesn't have anything to do with the restaurant itself, but I thought I would mention it just for the safety of it.

Anyways, we came in and it was pretty empty except for 3 middle aged and elderly men sitting near the counter(?). We all thought they were employees at first, but they kept staring over at our table. Literally without any shame. They even turned around to watch my friends walk towards the bathroom. Overall, for the location and experience I would have given it a 1 or 2 star(s).

NOW ONTO THE FOOD. My friends ordered bibimbap, taco trio, and kimchi fried rice with pork (?), while I ordered tteokbokki with ramen. I can't speak for my friends' meals, but they all really liked their food. I also really enjoyed my meal as well! Maybe personally for me, the sauce was a bit salty, but I still enjoyed it. 

Lastly, the service was pretty good. Not amazing, but better than most places. They were very friendly and kind. The only issue was that they were a bit slow and didn't seem to pay attention when we called them at times even though the restaurant was empty once those creepy men left. 

I was debating on giving this place three stars, but despite everything, I still liked the food, so four stars it is lmao!

excerpts:
Taco Trio $8 (http://bit.ly/2btKdqf)
wish other k tacos would learn from these
taco trio.author: Dan B.
taco trio.review:
didn't hear one person laugh the first 15-20 mins* i was in the mzafza. no wonder i'm single - if all those dullazz convos are what dating is, remind me to delete my tinderoni and not even bother getting my own cookie lyon. wait no i do want a cookie lyon.

TL;DR once the chicken's fully cooked this will be one of my #guiltypleasure / #straightfromthegym spots.

NLE;DR only reason i'm not saying 4 stars is too many pieces of pinkish / rawish fried chicken. but i told ms owner #ladiesispimpstoo, and i'm confident their fry game can rectify #soquicksofast.

(-_^) Sweet-Spicy Fried Chicken $8/$16 (http://bit.ly/2btJKEo)
very sweet, not spicy. generous crust

(-_^) Garlic Fried Chicken $8/$16 (http://bit.ly/2bTm5OZ)
"garlic heaven". bigbody crust

(-_^) Taco Trio $8 (http://bit.ly/2btKdqf)
wish other k tacos would learn from these
also wish tortillas warm or lightly toasted

MUSIC likeabossanova, jazz

PATRONS families, coughboringcough dates

SILVERWARE some ikea (that's a good thing)

DECOR classyish yet spacious enough to relax

alcohol and more menu items planned. i'll give them time before returning. but you can bet it'll be on my mind till then. #datnunadoe ;p

*yes i timed it beezys. for your educational benefit.

excerpts: - Taco trio: quite yummy

; although two of the tacos tasted quite similar
- Bibimbab: very good; my kid loved it
- Kalbi: they actually use good quality meat!
taco trio.author: Ankur V.
taco trio.review:
Came here for my kid's bday. He wanted to try a new Korean place ... we found this place and thought we would try it.

Had the following:
- Taco trio: quite yummy; although two of the tacos tasted quite similar
- Bibimbab: very good; my kid loved it
- Kalbi: they actually use good quality meat!
- Soup: don't remember the name; it's the one that has pork belly, although I substituted that with vegetables ... it was spicy and delish!

Overall, I loved this place. All four of us walked out happy and stuffed.

excerpts: Hangover soup, Jabchae and taco trio were delicious!
Highly recommend if you are new to Korean cuisine.
Food tastes very authentic.
Cheers!
taco trio.author: EunJoo C.
taco trio.review: Love this place. Hangover soup, Jabchae and taco trio were delicious!  Highly recommend if you are new to Korean cuisine. Food tastes very authentic. Cheers!

excerpts: My friend and I ordered the kimchi fried rice, taco trio (this was one of their popular and must try dish)
I wasn't disappointed because it was so good!
We also got the wings (1/2 garlic and 1/2 spicy).
The wings was so tasty.
I would definitely be back and try their other dishes!
taco trio.author: Louise C.
taco trio.review: I came here around 7pm on a Saturday night and got seated pretty quick. My friend and I ordered the kimchi fried rice, taco trio (this was one of their popular and must try dish) I wasn't disappointed because it was so good! We also got the wings (1/2 garlic and 1/2 spicy). The wings was so tasty. I would definitely be back and try their other dishes!

excerpts: Very good, we got the kimchi soup and the taco trio and it was very filling.
The soup was more than enough for two people and the taco trio was also very tasty.
Will return.
taco trio.author: Andrés Q.
taco trio.review: Very good, we got the kimchi soup and the taco trio and it was very filling. The soup was more than enough for two people and the taco trio was also very tasty. Will return.

excerpts: We ordered the taco trio (it was not really my favorite.
I'd skip it next time), sweet and spicy fried chicken (Korean fried chicken is so damn good), and pork belly.

There was a mixup in the kitchen and we didn't get our pork belly, but they were very apologetic about it and brought us free seaweed salad (REALLY GOOD), and we'd definitely over-ordered and by that point we were too full for it anyway.
The vibe in there is really nice and the service was maybe a little slow, but we weren't really in any hurry.
Overall really good experience, even with the mixup over the food.
They handled it very professionally.
I'm definitely going back to try the rest of the menu.
taco trio.author: Laura S.
taco trio.review: What a great new neighborhood spot! We tried it out on a Saturday night. It wasn't too busy--we got a table right away, but it filled up as we were there. We ordered the taco trio (it was not really my favorite. I'd skip it next time), sweet and spicy fried chicken (Korean fried chicken is so damn good), and pork belly. There was a mixup in the kitchen and we didn't get our pork belly, but they were very apologetic about it and brought us free seaweed salad (REALLY GOOD), and we'd definitely over-ordered and by that point we were too full for it anyway. The vibe in there is really nice and the service was maybe a little slow, but we weren't really in any hurry. Overall really good experience, even with the mixup over the food. They handled it very professionally. I'm definitely going back to try the rest of the menu.

excerpts: Bulgogi, taco trio, fried chicken and fried rice.
Everything was just great and the service was excellent!
taco trio.author: Kris K.
taco trio.review: Yummmmmm!! It was so delicious. The bbq short ribs were just fantastic. Bulgogi, taco trio, fried chicken and fried rice. Everything was just great and the service was excellent!

excerpts: Taco Trio was not too bad, would probably order it again.

3.5/5 Stars
-
Kimichi Soup was pretty good.
It came with lots of pork belly, but the soup taste was just ok.
Serving size is pretty large, so might be advised to share with someone if possible.
taco trio.author: Mario P.
taco trio.review:
Came here when I was randomly trying to fill my Korean food craving and was surprised to see they opened this spot in the Excelsior/Mission area. My experience was overall good, it just seems they are still working out some kinks with a new opening (just received alcohol license). Service was also very friendly and accommodating!

- Taco Trio was not too bad, would probably order it again. 3.5/5 Stars
- Kimichi Soup was pretty good. It came with lots of pork belly, but the soup taste was just ok. Serving size is pretty large, so might be advised to share with someone if possible. 3.5/5 Stars

Haven't had a chance to try the pork belly plate or galbi, so i'll most likely update this review once I try all those. 

Overall, I think the place has great potential and it is definitely has one of the nicer interiors in the area. Will definitely be returning soon. Please add a TV, that would really make it even better. :)

excerpts:
The Korean taco trio
 Chopped cooked steak and pork with hot kimchi and other seasonings.
These were drowning in a pink mayo which was ok, but i could have done with one eigth or less the amount.
taco trio.author: C H.
taco trio.review:
Walked in at 7:30 on a Saturday night. Bar was totally empty, and there were probably 4-5 empty tables. One big table of 20+ celebrating something was the bulk of the clientele.

Sat at the bar and ordered two dishes:

The Korean taco trio
 Chopped cooked steak and pork with hot kimchi and other seasonings.
 These were drowning in a pink mayo which was ok, but i could have done with one eigth or less the amount. Kind of gross.

the Korean fried chicken
 The seasonings were good (fresh garlic topping, and sweet and sour) but when it comes to Korean fired chicken, I prefer a much thinner, crispier batter.

I live nearby and there isn't another Korean option anywhere nearby. So I might come back to sample the bibimbop or bulgolgi, since those are very different dishes.

excerpts: It was also hard to stomach seeing another friend's taco trio being delivered to a table of two that had come after us and had already two dishes on their table.
taco trio.author: Jenny W.
taco trio.review:
Came here for dinner with five other co-workers and friends this week and this is a collective review from all of us lol. They must still be doing a soft opening as service is still somewhat lacking and the waitstaff could learn a few things. Maybe this isn't the best place for a big group-the food came staggered with me and another person's food coming first and then my last two co-worker's food coming a half an hour after we had already finished! The owner came out to explain why my friend's wings took so long (they had to re-do it) but no apologies. It was also hard to stomach seeing another friend's taco trio being delivered to a table of two that had come after us and had already two dishes on their table. So the service is spotty, how about the food?

-Yuk Ge Jang: Bland, broth was watery. I was definitely left hungry after.
-Pork Belly Platter: Flavor was very good, texture could be more tender. Questionable whether this was actually pork belly as there was hardly any fat and it was quite sturdy.
-Seafood Pancake: I didn't get to try this, but my two friends really liked it and would recommend it.
-Garlic Fried Chicken: Sweetened raw garlic slathered on top. Take away the raw garlic paste, the chicken itself was very bland. We think they added too much sugar to the raw garlic as it was almost sickly sweet.
-Sweet & Spicy Fried Chicken: This was a lot better, more flavorful. 
-Taco Trio: DEFINITELY the thing to get here. Not only is it a good value (they give you a SHIT-TON of meat-for now-for the price), the meats were very tender, piled on and flavorful. I wanted to actually order this after I tried my friend's but was afraid that it would take forever.

excerpts: Definitely get the Taco Trio.
A great sampling of different types of Korean tacos.
At the moment you can even BYOB!
taco trio.author: Luis I.
taco trio.review: This place is a great new spot! The service is friendly, the food is delicious. Definitely get the Taco Trio. A great sampling of different types of Korean tacos. At the moment you can even BYOB!

excerpts: We had bulgogi, taco trio, and kalbi.
Love the food.
Love the staff, especially Ina.
We were pleasantly surprised to find such a great Korean restaurant in the outside mission.
We would definitely come back again.
taco trio.author: Anthony N.
taco trio.review: Came by for dinner with a couple of friends.  We had bulgogi, taco trio, and kalbi.  Love the food.  Love the staff, especially Ina.  We were pleasantly surprised to find such a great Korean restaurant in the outside mission.  We would definitely come back again.

excerpts: We had the taco trio, hangover soup, kimchee fried rice and fried chicken wings (garlic and spicy).
Everything was delicious.
I'm Korean and have always complained about the lack of really good Korean food in the city.
Finally, Hwaro is helping up the Korean food scene in SF.
The dduk on the skewers appetizer is amazing.
So perfectly crispy on the outside but soft as you bite in.
Heaven!!!
taco trio.author: Annabelle H.
taco trio.review: Delicious Korean food in a hipster atmosphere. We had the taco trio, hangover soup, kimchee fried rice and fried chicken wings (garlic and spicy).  Everything was delicious. I'm Korean and have always complained about the lack of really good Korean food in the city. Finally, Hwaro is helping up the Korean food scene in SF. The dduk on the skewers appetizer is amazing. So perfectly crispy on the outside but soft as you bite in. Heaven!!!

excerpts: We ordered kimchi fried rice, taco trio, and rice cake skewers.
We were overly ambitious for ordering the rice cake skewers, but the taco trio and kimchi fried rice were legit.
We were overly ambitious for ordering the rice cake skewers, but the taco trio and kimchi fried rice were legit.
The taco trio is perfect for the indecisive folks since it includes combos of bulgogi, spicy pork belly, and kimchi.
Kimchi fried rice is just delicious any time of day.
rice cake skewers.author: Connie L.
rice cake skewers.review:
We were craving Korean food and the Sunset is just too far away to scavenge for food. We yelped it and came across this random restaurant in the mission - was surprisingly decent.

We ordered kimchi fried rice, taco trio, and rice cake skewers. We were overly ambitious for ordering the rice cake skewers, but the taco trio and kimchi fried rice were legit. The taco trio is perfect for the indecisive folks since it includes combos of bulgogi, spicy pork belly, and kimchi. Kimchi fried rice is just delicious any time of day. I would not say this place is purely Korean, since the food does taste slightly Americanized (like all Asian restaurants in this area), but it was still tasty and filling. 

The restaurant is super spacious and we did not have to wait to get seated (the best of both worlds especially when hungry). I wish they had a food truck some where so I can get these tacos on-the-go!

excerpts: Sweet and spicy sauce was similar to the one on the rice cake skewers.
The chicken is pretty big and filling.
The batter is pretty fluffy which makes the chicken look massive.
Personal preference here
, I don't prefer fried chicken with this fluffy kind of tempura batter, wish there was less batter or a different kind, my go to standard for asian chicken wings is at SO.
rice cake skewers.author: Baek C.
rice cake skewers.review:
Went there last night and enjoyed the experience/food.

Definitely love having different types of restaurants in the outer mission area. Not many other restaurants besides mexican or chinese food, so korean was a welcome change.

The interior and decor was very unexpected in a good way.  Modern and minimal design with large open space. 

Things we ordered:

- Rice cake skewer
fried/grilled korean rice cake with a sweet spicy sauce.  Texture was great, crunchy outside, gooey inside.  Sauce was nice and balanced.  One thing I would suggest to make it even better is to add some green onion slices in between the rice cakes. Also some sesame seeds on top.  I think that would bring out another level of flavor.

- Grilled eel plate
Comes out with dipping sauce, ginger, and lettuce to make wraps.  Awesome flavor and perfectly cooked.  Highly recommend getting this.

- Garlic and sweet spicy fried chicken
Flavor of the sweet garlic sauce was good.  Sweet and spicy sauce was similar to the one on the rice cake skewers. The chicken is pretty big and filling. The batter is pretty fluffy which makes the chicken look massive.  
Personal preference here, I don't prefer fried chicken with this fluffy kind of tempura batter, wish there was less batter or a different kind, my go to standard for asian chicken wings is at SO.  But with that said, I know others like this style, and the batter/breading was done well.

- Cold bibim buckwheat noodle
Flavor was good and the sauce was nice and balanced.
One suggestion is that it did not come with a hard boiled egg, or a slice of meat, which I think would complete the dish.  Also the portion was pretty small for the price, especially considering that an egg or beef slices were not in the dish.


Overall, I enjoyed the restaurant especially considering it being in the outer mission area. I would give this place 3 1/2 stars, but bumped it up for location, service, and since it only just opened.

Definitely going to come back to see how it progresses, and once they get their liquor/beer/wine license. They have a nice bar setup, and hope they have some nice beers on tap (always goes good with fried chicken).

excerpts: I especially liked the  Rice cake Skewers as they brought me back to Korea.
The Kimchi Soup will be my goto this winter on cold rainy nights.
rice cake skewers.author: glenn w.
rice cake skewers.review: What a wonderful surprise in the Outer Mission. On a recent trip to Korea I fell in love with the food. So when I returned to S.F. I wanted to experience Korean food with the same authenticity as I encountered in Seoul. Hwaro delivered! The staff was so friendly and knowledgeable. The music was perfect and at just the right level. And then the food, wow! Every dish had honest flavors. I especially liked the  Rice cake Skewers as they brought me back to Korea. The Kimchi Soup will be my goto this winter on cold rainy nights. I also tried the Pork Belly  and Spicy Squid, both were delicious! The big Mushroom was stuffed with super tender and tasty Bulgogi And just when I thought I could not eat another bite, the Seafood  Pancake came out. It was better then the ones I had in Insa-dong. If you are craving authentic and honest Korean food , then this is THE place!

excerpts: Our favorites are the galbi, hangover soup, and japchae.
The prices are not cheap, but the portions are decent.
I've ordered using UberEats and so far I've never had a hitch in the process.
hangover soup.author: Jean L.
hangover soup.review:
I'm so excited that there is a decent Korean place near me that delivers! In the past month I've ordered from here 3 times already and so far it's been consistently good. 

Our favorites are the galbi, hangover soup, and japchae. The prices are not cheap, but the portions are decent. I've ordered using UberEats and so far I've never had a hitch in the process.

excerpts: We want to try the hangover soup and the Korean ramen.
hangover soup.author: Robert T.
hangover soup.review: Hwaro is a relax, modern and hip Korean restaurant with delicious food.  Came here with my family and friends and we really enjoyed ourselves. The kids love the sweet potato fries and corn cheese. I mean who doesn't like fries and cheese? The fries were hot and the corn was full of yummy gooey cheese! We also ordered the Garlic Chicken, Kalbi, Miso Pork Belly, chilled squid salad, Vegetable Basket, japchae, Korean style pancake and the "old" Kimchi. The house made Kimchi was delicious but the best were the wings. According to everyone, they were seasoned perfectly and were finger licking good. My family and friends said they can drink the refreshing citron soju and eat the garlic chicken wings all day!  Being a vegetarian, I ate most of the mushroom japchae and enjoyed the fresh veggie wraps that I made with the veggie basket. The citron soju was indeed refreshing. We also tried the peach soju and all of us prefer the citron soju. For dessert, we had vanilla and Strawberry mochi ice cream and green tea cheesecake. The service was very attentive and we didn't feel rushed even though the restaurant was full. It was a scrumptious meal and we'll certainly be back! We want to try the hangover soup and the Korean ramen.

excerpts: We ordered the kimchi cheese, hangover soup, and fried chicken (half garlic half spicy).
Everything was pretty delicious.
I wish the kimchi cheese came with more chips.
The hangover soup came with plenty of beef .
And the fried chicken came on a hot plate so you can flip the the garlic chicken around and cook the garlic more if you want.
Overall a nice place for a causal dinner and night out with friends.
Service was great and parking wasn't too bad.
hangover soup.author: Len L.
hangover soup.review: Came here on a Saturday night around 8:30 and there were plenty of tables open.  This place has pretty cool decor and spacious.  We ordered the kimchi cheese, hangover soup, and fried chicken (half garlic half spicy).  Everything was pretty delicious.  I wish the kimchi cheese came with more chips.  The hangover soup came with plenty of beef .  And the fried chicken came on a hot plate so you can flip the the garlic chicken around and cook the garlic more if you want.  Overall a nice place for a causal dinner and night out with friends.  Service was great and parking wasn't too bad.

excerpts: We will be back to try that cheese corn and hangover soup!
hangover soup.author: Donna L.
hangover soup.review:
We keep coming back to enjoy the food and the company of the gracious host Ina and her brother chef Ryan.  The 12 of us always enjoy our evenings drinking pitchers of beers and numerous bottles of soju. This time we ordered double orders of fried chicken,sweet and spicy fried chicken,seafood pancake, japchae, kalbi and pork belly sizzling BBQ.  The sweet and spicy chicken was more spicy than sweet. The fried chicken was good but I prefer a thinner batter. But the wings were huge!  The seafood pancake was yummy and I loved the kalbi and it's flavor.  I could have eaten the japchae plate by myself!  Although the pork belly was on a sizzling platter - I want my pork to be crispy!  Ina and her brother Ryan are the perfect hosts. Our table is always set up just the way we like it!  And they don't even mind that we are so loud. 

And for all the dishes we ordered and alcohol we consumed - when we got the check - it wasn't that much per person. So that's my hot tip -bring a bunch of friends so you can share dishes and try everything!   We will be back to try that cheese corn and hangover soup!

excerpts: And the hangover soup if I do a lot of drinking the night before ;)
hangover soup.author: Bailey L.
hangover soup.review:
I came here on a Saturday around 8-9pm and got seated right away, since they close at 10pm. We got really lucky and found parking right in front! From looking through yelp reviews to see what was most popular, we decided to order the taco trio, cheese corn, and Korean ramen with spam and kimchi for two people. We also ended up getting a bottle of peach soju to go with our meal :) Everything turned out to be super yummy and we ended up finishing everything we ordered! (This doesn't happen a lot because I usually get full really easily) 

I really enjoyed the Korean ramen, especially on a cold, rainy day. It's a bit different from the tofu soup at other Korean restaurants with ramen added to it, but I really like the flavoring and the ramen texture here. I would definitely order this again. You have the options of adding cheese, spam or kimchi for an additional price - I believe it was $1/$2 for each item. We decided to go with just the spam and kimchi since we're already having a lot of cheese from the cheese corn! 

The cheese corn has a nice presentation and tastes pretty good as well! I like how it has the Panko/fried bread crumbs along the sides and some siracha sauce on top. It is not the best cheese corn that I've ever had, but it is pretty good and unique from the other cheese corn dishes I've had at other places. 

The taco trio was super juicy and flavorful! It has three different kinds of meat I believe and I enjoyed all of them! :) i wouldn't mind if there was a little bit less of that orange sauce though, it was a bit too saucy for me, but that probably varies and I don't mind it too much so I would definitely order this again. Maybe next time there will be less orange sauce on it and not drenched like this time! 

I am looking forward to coming back and trying more items on the menu. Maybe the wings next time? And the hangover soup if I do a lot of drinking the night before ;)

excerpts:
Kim chi fried rice 2/5 eh I've had better 
Hangover soup 1/5 had more veggies and meat than the soup itself
Wings (sweet and spicy) 2/5
very sweet and nothing spicy.
It tasted like lumpia dipping sauce...
hangover soup.author: Elaine C.
hangover soup.review:
I don't like this place at all. 

Came here for dinner and I'm not surprised it was empty. 

Got seated and ordered right away. They stopped by with a sweet potatoes (?) and mayo shortly after. Weird combination and didn't like the taste...

Ordered:

Trio tacos 1/5 did not like the sauce. 
Kim chi fried rice 2/5 eh I've had better 
Hangover soup 1/5 had more veggies and meat than the soup itself
Wings (sweet and spicy) 2/5 very sweet and nothing spicy. It tasted like lumpia dipping sauce...
Miso garlic pork belly 2/5 flavors didn't go together and pork belly was cut too thin

Overall, pretty disappointed with the food. The flavors didn't go together and nothing authentic. The banchan was mediocre. OH the water had stuff floating inside it (was hoping it was lemon bits). 

Won't be back.

excerpts: Got the "Hangover Soup" and pork belly on the side.
hangover soup.author: Josh K.
hangover soup.review:
Came for the first weekend these guys opened up for their brunch hours. Got the "Hangover Soup" and pork belly on the side. 

I never write yelp reviews but this place is the bomb! Legitimate Korean food made by Korean people (heard 'em in the kitchen) at very reasonable prices. Service was good and simple, and it was an easy and comfortable experience all around.

excerpts: I can't wait to come back for more; would love to try their korean ramen and especially the hangover soup that everyone raves about!
hangover soup.author: Kris C.
hangover soup.review:
Delicious!!! I went with a big group, so I was able to try a good portion of their menu.

Favorites!
- Taco trio: love fusion tacos! These were filled with variations of lettuce, kimchi, bulgogi, spicy pork, and a creamy mayo-based sauce to tie everything together. 
- Garlic pork belly BBQ plate: We were debating between this and the galbi, and I'm so happy we went with pork belly! Tender and flavorful, and went well with the lettuce wraps (wish they gave only lettuce, the cabbage included was odd). I enjoyed the mini trio of sides that came with it (kimchi, cucumber, sauce) to enjoy the pork belly+lettuce with. Highly recommend! 
- Seafood pancake: Although I wish it was a tad bit crispier, this was delicious and made for a wonderful appetizer. Dipping sauce was yummy--I wish it came with more!

Others:
- Kimchi cheese: Okay, I LOVE kimchi, but keep in mind that a lot of their dishes already come with kimchi. This dish was kimchi-overkill, especially noting that the majority of our dishes had or came with kimchi. I would pass on this one, and would try their cheese corn instead for some variety.
- Kimchi fried rice: It was good, nothing extraordinary. Standard kimchi fried rice that didn't have any wow factor for me.
- Garlic fried chicken: The garlic is apparently sweetened with combined sugar, but it just tasted (and definitely felt) like raw garlic to me. I would pass on this one.
- Sweet n' spicy fried chicken: If you like a lot of sauce on your wings, then this might be for you! Personally, I would love to try their regular bare fried chicken instead--the meat itself is indeed crispy and juicy!

I can't wait to come back for more; would love to try their korean ramen and especially the hangover soup that everyone raves about!

excerpts: My friend and I came and ordered 3 things (which was way too much for us hahaha): 1/2 garlic and 1/2 sweet and spicy chicken, the taco trio, and the hangover soup!
- Fried chicken: loved the KFC here, the batter was thick and crunchy and the wings were huge.
The garlic sauce needs a little work (it's pretty much raw garlic and sugar), but I did like the sweet and spicy sauce (it wasn't spicy at all btw).
- Taco trio: Loved this!!
I love Asian fusion tacos
so we had to order this.
The combo of kimchi, lettuce, and Korean-marinated meat was delish!
They came with a pretty generous amount of meat too.
- Hangover soup: I thought this would be the most underwhelming
but it was actually really good!
The soup was very rich and flavorful and would probably taste good with some rice.
hangover soup.author: Tara A.
hangover soup.review:
Glad Excelsior/outer Mission is being put on the map finally! Hwaro is a good choice when you want something different, Asian fusion-y, or Korean!

My friend and I came and ordered 3 things (which was way too much for us hahaha): 1/2 garlic and 1/2 sweet and spicy chicken, the taco trio, and the hangover soup!
- Fried chicken: loved the KFC here, the batter was thick and crunchy and the wings were huge. The garlic sauce needs a little work (it's pretty much raw garlic and sugar), but I did like the sweet and spicy sauce (it wasn't spicy at all btw).
- Taco trio: Loved this!! I love Asian fusion tacos so we had to order this. The combo of kimchi, lettuce, and Korean-marinated meat was delish! They came with a pretty generous amount of meat too.
- Hangover soup: I thought this would be the most underwhelming but it was actually really good! The soup was very rich and flavorful and would probably taste good with some rice. The meat was suuuper tender in this soup!

Service was a little weird.. When we asked the waitress about certain menu items, she couldn't even describe them, lol!! Also when we got our receipt to pay with credit card (we split 2 cards), they forgot to include my receipt to sign.. Eh!

I would love to come back and try the pork belly, galbi, or the bugolgi. We saw tables ordering these and they looked great with the lettuce wraps! The lunch bentos also look really good and are nicely priced.

excerpts: The hangover soup was rich with tender beef pieces.
hangover soup.author: Liz K.
hangover soup.review:
The Glee soundtrack was playing on repeat the entire time we were in the restaurant. My personal hell.

Food was great. Fried chicken was light and crispy. The hangover soup was rich with tender beef pieces.

excerpts: Hangover soup - expected to have more soup...
hangover soup.author: Ada L.
hangover soup.review:
UberEATS review: Ordered from them twice. First time they missed the Bulgogi, the second time they missed the wraps on all my barbecue items. Unacceptable service if you were to do delivery.  

Items are on the pricier side and tbh not worth it. 

Hangover soup - expected to have more soup... the veg and meat are overwhelming

Kalbi - small portion for $27, otherwise it's tastes good

Miso pork belly - salty. It would be alright if paired with vegi wrap

Japchae - great taste

Corn cheese - They put tempura crumb and tomato sauce... meh

Half and half Chicken wings - like the sweet sauce. They do put big chunk of garlic. Not impressive. 

End note: spent too much on a mediocre restaurant. not coming back.

excerpts: They have Korean ramen and a Hangover Soup!
hangover soup.author: Michael C.
hangover soup.review:
A new, modern Korean restaurant in the Excelsior playing bossanova? YES!

I was a bit upset when I saw Goldilocks close. I had recently been there and while it was my third favorite Filipino restaurant in Excelsior, they did introduce me to some new stuff.

My mood changed when I saw the sign on the door saying the new place was Hwaro, a Korean restaurant. Excelsior has Filipino, Japanese, Thai, Laotian, Vietnamese, all types of Chinese. But we don't have Korean. 

Let alone one that serves alcohol.

This week they are going through a soft launch - they don't officially open or have a working credit card until 9/5/16 - but are taking customers. The lunch menu is very different from the dinner, which also explains the large break in between.

When I walked in on a Tuesday, there were a few groups eating - and I do recommend coming here in a group or on a date so you can try more. I sat by myself and spent time on the menu. They have a number of small plates that sound great like the Taco Trio, gyoza, and asparagus because something has to be green. 

There are also big plates which are must shares. Three types of KFC (Korean Fried Chicken), kimchee fried rice, seafood pancakes, tonkatsu. They have Korean ramen and a Hangover Soup! 

I went with the sizzling BBQ eel. I love eel, heck I've had eel fried rice directly across the street. The great waitress warned me it was only 6 pieces but that was enough for tonight. Along with it came some lettuce to make wraps, some banchan, and I ordered a side of rice. It was delicious and it will be hard not to order it again.

Or live out a dream and special order a BBQ eel taco.

After finishing up I got to talk to the two waitresses, the owner Ina jamming out to classic bossanova, and the head chef Ryan. They explained some of the backstory, how they will soon be getting three types of Korean beer (including Hite!), shoju, and wine, and that the neighborhood has welcomed them. 

I really like Hwaro and feel it not only adds a culinary option to Excelsior, but adds a more modern option as well. With Rocks Den, Sushi Raw, and now Hwaro, this part of Excelsior is getting some gentrification. Not white people (says the white person), but more gentrifying for Millenials - modern locations with a modern vibe. I don't want the area to be completely changed - I may actually be addicted to Baby's lumpia - but I like that we are getting options to take groups or dates to. Excelsior isn't only for cheap lunch, and Hwaro helps this.

UPDATE: I came over for lunch and got the sweet and spicy fried chicken bento and the pork belly quesadilla. The bento came with side salad, some of the least greasy japchae I've ever had, two dumplings, rice, kimchi and 4 wings covered in sauce. Ask for extra napkins! I definitely got a lot of sauce on my face/beard. The wings were cooked perfectly, and the sauce was both sweet and spicy. Not bad for the amount of food I got.

But the pork belly quesadilla stole the show! I want one right now. Full of delicious pork belly, kimchi, cheese, sauce, and I want to say butter because it was decadent. Still can't wait to bring people here.

Update 9/18: Took two friends here for dinner to finally get a group dinner going. We got:
-Corn Cheese - basically a skillet filled with sweet corn and mozzarella cheese. Two things I love
-Gyoza - I'm a sucker for dumplings
-Rice Cake Skewers - Because it was my birthday, the owner gave these to us on the house, and explained that growing up in Korea, this was one of her favorite street food snacks. We got two skewers with about 5 rice cakes on top, covered in the sweet and spicy sauce from the chicken wings. If you like sweet and spicy, these are really good, a bit chewy. Glad I got to try these!
-Kimchee Pancake - one of my guests doesn't like seafood, which is why we got this. Turns out he also doesn't like kimchee, SMH. This was delicious.
-Kimchee Fried Rice - yeah, my friend didn't have the best meal, but his loss. This was delicious, spicy fried rice with some seaweed which gives it a really interesting flavor. But man that pork belly is so good.

Oh, and for my return trip I was recommended trying the miso pork belly.

Also they have the cleanest bathroom in Excelsior.

excerpts: The hangover soup is amazing, the perfect amount of meats, veggies and spices to cure the worst of headaches.
hangover soup.author: Y L.
hangover soup.review:
The restaurant is not fully open yet but they are taking customers while they tie up all the loose ends. 

The hangover soup is amazing, the perfect amount of meats, veggies and spices to cure the worst of headaches. They take a unique spin on traditional Korean plates such as honey glazed fried chicken and mozarella fish cakes while carrying the traditional items like bibimbap and seafood pancakes. 

The decor is warm and inviting so you feel at home here.

The staff is very sweet and eager to help.

Definitely worth a visit.

excerpts: Fried Rice with Pork, Bulgulgi and Hangover Soup.
Finally a new destination in the city without going down to the South Bay.....
hangover soup.author: Jen W.
hangover soup.review: Best new find for homey Korean food!! Love the Kimchi  Fried Rice with Pork, Bulgulgi and Hangover Soup.  Finally a new destination in the city without going down to the South Bay.....

excerpts: Hangover soup, Jabchae and taco trio were delicious!
Highly recommend if you are new to Korean cuisine.
Food tastes very authentic.
Cheers!
hangover soup.author: EunJoo C.
hangover soup.review: Love this place. Hangover soup, Jabchae and taco trio were delicious!  Highly recommend if you are new to Korean cuisine. Food tastes very authentic. Cheers!

excerpts: They serve one of my favorite Korean soups: the hangover soup which, for some reason, is rarely ever offered in other restaurants.
I'd say that you definitely dont need to order a lot to get filled up unless you have a huge appetite or want more variety.
hangover soup.author: Victoria H.
hangover soup.review:
The closest Korean restaurant I could possibly ask for. This place is a fusion so if you're looking for "authentic" Korean food, look elsewhere. They serve one of my favorite Korean soups: the hangover soup which, for some reason, is rarely ever offered in other restaurants. I'd say that you definitely dont need to order a lot to get filled up unless you have a huge appetite or want more variety. I still want more banchan though lol

The waiters and waitresses are all very nice people and can accommadate you whenever possible. If you sit at the bar/really long table, the waiters dont mind talking to you. It's really a shame that they only open for dinner now. In the beginning, they opened for lunch but I guess there's too little business in this part of town during that time. =(

excerpts: We got sizzling pork belly, asparagus, King oyster mushroom, hangover soup, and garlic fried chicken!
Every dish is delicious, garlic fried chicken and sizzling pork belly are my favorite.
Service is wonderful, even though they just opened for 1 week(no advertising, not even soft opening yet)
it's already crowded and throughout the night till they close.
I can't wait for the grand opening!!!
Will definitely go back and invite my friends there.
hangover soup.author: Fanny Z.
hangover soup.review:
I'm beyond impressed by everything we ordered tonight!! We got sizzling pork belly, asparagus, King oyster mushroom, hangover soup, and garlic fried chicken! Every dish is delicious, garlic fried chicken and sizzling pork belly are my favorite. Service is wonderful, even though they just opened for 1 week(no advertising, not even soft opening yet) it's already crowded and throughout the night till they close.
I can't wait for the grand opening!!! Will definitely go back and invite my friends there.

excerpts: We order the hangover soup, the sizing pork belly,  garlic friend chicken,  asparagus and mushrooms.
hangover soup.author: SFoodie P.
hangover soup.review: I use to live right on Sta Rosa Street.  This Korean place finally opened... I am impressed.  Met the owner Ina,  her staff in the kitchen is her Mom and brother.  The restaurant is family business,  she has another place at International restaurant on Kearney.  The food is very authentic and "good".  We order the hangover soup, the sizing pork belly,  garlic friend chicken,  asparagus and mushrooms.

excerpts: My boyfriend and I tried friend chickens (half garlic, half sweet spicy), pork belly bbq, hangover soup, and ddeok go chi
-- The portion was huuuuge and all the dishes were served fast.
hangover soup.author: Juwon K.
hangover soup.review:
As a Korean native, this place cured my homesickness. Hwaro offers authentic modern korean dishes in a humble, clean environment. Unlike other Korean restaurants with a menu book of 10 pages, their menu is simple but various enough to satisfy different tastes. 

My boyfriend and I tried friend chickens (half garlic, half sweet spicy), pork belly bbq, hangover soup, and ddeok go chi  -- The portion was huuuuge and all the dishes were served fast. If you go there in big group, it would really be nice to share different plates. 

They are on the soft open period and are expected to fully open in 2 weeks. I am so looking forward to seeing it growing!

excerpts: With that being said, I had ordered the hangover soup, kalbi, sweet and sour chicken wings, spicy squid, and seafood ramen to share between my family and I.
We definitely got what we paid for.
The food was not cheap
but it sure was delicious.
The flavor of the food exceeded our standards and expectations of Korean food.
hangover soup.author: Rachel L.
hangover soup.review: I'm giving this a 4 for now because I only got take out and never ate physically at a table. With that being said, I had ordered the hangover soup, kalbi, sweet and sour chicken wings, spicy squid, and seafood ramen to share between my family and I. We definitely got what we paid for. The food was not cheap but it sure was delicious. The flavor of the food exceeded our standards and expectations of Korean food.

excerpts: The hangover soup is very spicy.
I hope they expand their menu of lighter, healthier foods.
I live in the neighborhood and look forward to coming back and giving it a second chance.
hangover soup.author: Ethan C.
hangover soup.review: The ambiance at Hwaro is great, while the food is okay. For people who enjoy heavier foods like red meat, noodles and fried food, there are plenty of choices. For those who like vegetables and non-fried dishes, there is very little to choose from. The staff is attentive and friendly. My wife liked the gyoza and my daughter liked the fried chicken. The hangover soup is very spicy. I hope they expand their menu of lighter, healthier foods. I live in the neighborhood and look forward to coming back and giving it a second chance.

excerpts: We had japchae, a Korean clear noodle dish in addition to our usual Kalbi, spicy pork belly, Bibimbap, and the Hangover soup, which were all excellent.
Our friends also loved the food and the restaurant, a discovery for them.
, Portabella mushrooms stuffed with bulgogi, Bibimbop (rice mixed with various ingredients served in a hot stone bowl) , Hangover soup (spicy beef soup), Pork belly and Kalbi
(broiled beef short ribs).
They served three little banchan (side dishes), consisting of spinach, kimchi, and a special sauce.

This may sound meager, but all the three items were delicious - the kimchi was fresh and flavorful (best we had among all Korean restaurants in the Bay Area), and the special sauce consisting of miso and hot sauce and garlic was outstanding in flavor!
Much better than many more side dishes which all taste bland as in some other Korean restaurants I reviewed.

The tacos were outstanding as was the portabella mushrooms stuffed with bulgogi - these fusion dishes were so flavorful they would not be out of place in Quince or Benu (see my reviews of these outstanding restaurants).
They serve a bowl of lettuce and Napa cabbage leaves, which can be used to wrap the pork belly, kalbi, or bibimbop with the special sauce, adding a fresh, crunchy contrast to the hot dishes.
The pork belly and kalbi were both seasoned just right and delicious and the bibombop in sizzling hot stone bowl was also delicious.
The spicy beef hangover soup was also very tasty and satisfying.
They have beer and wine and Korean special beverages -
Soju (tastes like weak vodka) and Makgeolli (milky Korean rice wine).
We had both Soju and Makgeolli, but wife wound up ordering Sauvignon blanc (a very good one-
Joel Gott).
Although located in a somewhat gentrifying neighborhood, the restaurant has a clean,  modern feel with nice murals, though the chairs could be more comfortable.
The service was very friendly and prompt.
We would recommend this restaurant for foodies like us who are willing to travel a bit to find a truly satisfying gastronomic experience.
Definitely will come again.
Their website indicates they also deliver thru Doordash or Uber Eats..
hangover soup.author: Hoyle L.
hangover soup.review:
Updated 5/14/17
We had dinner last night with two friends and re-affirm the review wrote about three weeks ago (below).  We might add that the restaurant was full around 6:30 PM on Saturday, and the noise level was not quite as loud as we had feared, in spite of families with children being there.  We were greeted warmly and had our reserved tables waiting for us.  The combination tacos, Portobello mushrooms stuffed with bulgogi were again outstanding.  We had japchae, a Korean clear noodle dish in addition to our usual Kalbi, spicy pork belly, Bibimbap, and the Hangover soup, which were all excellent.  Our friends also loved the food and the restaurant, a discovery for them. Glad we came back!

Previous Review, April, 2017
An outstanding Korean/Fusion restaurant with creative and flavorful food.  We came here from across town based on reviews because we wanted to find a Korean restaurant that was worthy of bringing knowledgeable friends, and the trip was not wasted.  Coming rather early on a Saturday evening, we were greeted warmly and had a choice of tables (They do accept reservations by phone, only when they are open after 5 PM).  We ordered the combination tacos (bulgogi+pork belly, bulgogi+kimchi, and pork belly+kimchi), Portabella mushrooms stuffed with bulgogi, Bibimbop (rice mixed with various ingredients served in a hot stone bowl) , Hangover soup (spicy beef soup), Pork belly and Kalbi (broiled beef short ribs).  They served three little banchan (side dishes), consisting of spinach, kimchi, and a special sauce.  This may sound meager, but all the three items were delicious - the kimchi was fresh and flavorful (best we had among all Korean restaurants in the Bay Area), and the special sauce consisting of miso and hot sauce and garlic was outstanding in flavor!  Much better than many more side dishes which all taste bland as in some other Korean restaurants I reviewed.  The tacos were outstanding as was the portabella mushrooms stuffed with bulgogi - these fusion dishes were so flavorful they would not be out of place in Quince or Benu (see my reviews of these outstanding restaurants).
