They serve a bowl of lettuce and Napa cabbage leaves, which can be used to wrap the pork belly, kalbi, or bibimbop with the special sauce, adding a fresh, crunchy contrast to the hot dishes.  The pork belly and kalbi were both seasoned just right and delicious and the bibombop in sizzling hot stone bowl was also delicious.  The spicy beef hangover soup was also very tasty and satisfying.  They have beer and wine and Korean special beverages - Soju (tastes like weak vodka) and Makgeolli (milky Korean rice wine).  We had both Soju and Makgeolli, but wife wound up ordering Sauvignon blanc (a very good one- Joel Gott).  Although located in a somewhat gentrifying neighborhood, the restaurant has a clean,  modern feel with nice murals, though the chairs could be more comfortable.  The service was very friendly and prompt.  We would recommend this restaurant for foodies like us who are willing to travel a bit to find a truly satisfying gastronomic experience.  Definitely will come again.  Their website indicates they also deliver thru Doordash or Uber Eats..

excerpts: Had their kalbi, chopchae and hangover soup; tasty across the board.
We threw in a bottle of soju for good measure and left happy.
They were even so kind as to comp us the soju because it was our wedding anniversary!
We dig it!
hangover soup.author: Joseph M.
hangover soup.review: Modern spin on Korean food staples. Simple comfy decor and mixed crowd; a good representation of The E! Wait staff was very attentive and friendly. Had their kalbi, chopchae and hangover soup; tasty across the board. We threw in a bottle of soju for good measure and left happy. They were even so kind as to comp us the soju because it was our wedding anniversary! We dig it!

excerpts: I had the hangover soup and my friend had honey garlic chicken wings.
The soup was really delicious and the portion was big!
My friend loved his chicken wings.
Will definitely come back again to try their other items!
hangover soup.author: Eddie T.
hangover soup.review: My friend and I went on Christmas day for dinner. The place was packed and the service was great! I had the hangover soup and my friend had honey garlic chicken wings. The soup was really delicious and the portion was big! My friend loved his chicken wings. Will definitely come back again to try their other items!

excerpts: We had the taco trio, hangover soup, kimchee fried rice and fried chicken wings (garlic and spicy).
Everything was delicious.
I'm Korean and have always complained about the lack of really good Korean food in the city.
Finally, Hwaro is helping up the Korean food scene in SF.
The dduk on the skewers appetizer is amazing.
So perfectly crispy on the outside but soft as you bite in.
Heaven!!!
hangover soup.author: Annabelle H.
hangover soup.review: Delicious Korean food in a hipster atmosphere. We had the taco trio, hangover soup, kimchee fried rice and fried chicken wings (garlic and spicy).  Everything was delicious. I'm Korean and have always complained about the lack of really good Korean food in the city. Finally, Hwaro is helping up the Korean food scene in SF. The dduk on the skewers appetizer is amazing. So perfectly crispy on the outside but soft as you bite in. Heaven!!!

excerpts: We want to try the hangover soup and the Korean ramen.
korean ramen.author: Robert T.
korean ramen.review: Hwaro is a relax, modern and hip Korean restaurant with delicious food.  Came here with my family and friends and we really enjoyed ourselves. The kids love the sweet potato fries and corn cheese. I mean who doesn't like fries and cheese? The fries were hot and the corn was full of yummy gooey cheese! We also ordered the Garlic Chicken, Kalbi, Miso Pork Belly, chilled squid salad, Vegetable Basket, japchae, Korean style pancake and the "old" Kimchi. The house made Kimchi was delicious but the best were the wings. According to everyone, they were seasoned perfectly and were finger licking good. My family and friends said they can drink the refreshing citron soju and eat the garlic chicken wings all day!  Being a vegetarian, I ate most of the mushroom japchae and enjoyed the fresh veggie wraps that I made with the veggie basket. The citron soju was indeed refreshing. We also tried the peach soju and all of us prefer the citron soju. For dessert, we had vanilla and Strawberry mochi ice cream and green tea cheesecake. The service was very attentive and we didn't feel rushed even though the restaurant was full. It was a scrumptious meal and we'll certainly be back! We want to try the hangover soup and the Korean ramen.

excerpts: We ordered the Korean ramen, Kimchi Fried Rice w/ pork, and Garlic pork belly.
Only downside of the food was the limited banchan and the ramen.
The banchan is not like your typical kbbq restaurant where they serve you 5+ banchan options.
Here, they only serve kimchi and bean sprouts.
Both good, but wish there was more in quantity and more variety in the banchan.
The ramen tasted like instant ramen and they tossed in some spicy Korean broth.
I was craving noodles that night
korean ramen.author: Debby N.
korean ramen.review:
My experience here was okay. Some words to describe this place: modern, cozy, warm, and hip. Good food and welcoming space for a date or to catch up with friends. 

Came here on a Tuesday night w/ my bf a couple weeks ago. The staff noticed us right away upon entering, but took a while for us to be seated. Service was slow that night, not sure why since the restaurant wasn't even packed, but it picked up as the night went on. 

Food was okay. Everything we ordered was shared/shareable, which was nice. We ordered the Korean ramen, Kimchi Fried Rice w/ pork, and Garlic pork belly. Only downside of the food was the limited banchan and the ramen. The banchan is not like your typical kbbq restaurant where they serve you 5+ banchan options. Here, they only serve kimchi and bean sprouts. Both good, but wish there was more in quantity and more variety in the banchan. The ramen tasted like instant ramen and they tossed in some spicy Korean broth. I was craving noodles that night so it was okay and filling, but I would not recommend ordering this nor would I order this again for $11. 

Kimchi fried rice had all the right flavors. It was pretty spicy for me and my bf. A simple but filling dish - rice, kimchi, dry seaweed, pork, and a fried egg on top. $13

Favorite of the night was the garlic pork belly. It came out last, BUT tasted so good. Kinda pricy though for $21. If you love garlic like me, then you'll enjoy this dish. Jam-packed with flavor, the garlic pork belly is served on a sizzling plate and is more than enough meat to share with another person.

All in all, I'd probably come back to try other items if I'm in the area and use that 10% off check in on yelp!

excerpts: Korean ramen, isn't that a no-no?
Not here, it's an amazing dish full of flavor.
Check it out and enjoy!
korean ramen.author: Matthew T.
korean ramen.review: Hwaro is a hidden gem within Excelsior. This Korean fusion restaurant provides great Koren food, fun vibes with full bar menu, and delightful service. The kimchi pancake was amazing as a starter. Korean ramen, isn't that a no-no? Not here, it's an amazing dish full of flavor. Check it out and enjoy!

excerpts: From looking through yelp reviews to see what was most popular, we decided to order the taco trio, cheese corn, and Korean ramen with spam and kimchi for two people.
We also ended up getting a bottle of peach soju to go with our meal
Everything turned out to be super yummy and we ended up finishing everything we ordered!
I really enjoyed the Korean ramen, especially on a cold, rainy day.
It's a bit different from the tofu soup at other Korean restaurants with ramen added to it, but I really like the flavoring and the ramen texture here.
I would definitely order this again.
You have the options of adding cheese, spam or kimchi for an additional price -
I believe it was $1/$2 for each item.
The taco trio was super juicy and flavorful!
It has three different kinds of meat I believe
and I enjoyed all of them!
:) i wouldn't mind if there was a little bit less of that orange sauce though
, it was a bit too saucy for me, but that probably varies and I don't mind it too much
so I would definitely order this again.
korean ramen.author: Bailey L.
korean ramen.review:
I came here on a Saturday around 8-9pm and got seated right away, since they close at 10pm. We got really lucky and found parking right in front! From looking through yelp reviews to see what was most popular, we decided to order the taco trio, cheese corn, and Korean ramen with spam and kimchi for two people. We also ended up getting a bottle of peach soju to go with our meal :) Everything turned out to be super yummy and we ended up finishing everything we ordered! (This doesn't happen a lot because I usually get full really easily) 

I really enjoyed the Korean ramen, especially on a cold, rainy day. It's a bit different from the tofu soup at other Korean restaurants with ramen added to it, but I really like the flavoring and the ramen texture here. I would definitely order this again. You have the options of adding cheese, spam or kimchi for an additional price - I believe it was $1/$2 for each item. We decided to go with just the spam and kimchi since we're already having a lot of cheese from the cheese corn! 

The cheese corn has a nice presentation and tastes pretty good as well! I like how it has the Panko/fried bread crumbs along the sides and some siracha sauce on top. It is not the best cheese corn that I've ever had, but it is pretty good and unique from the other cheese corn dishes I've had at other places. 

The taco trio was super juicy and flavorful! It has three different kinds of meat I believe and I enjoyed all of them! :) i wouldn't mind if there was a little bit less of that orange sauce though, it was a bit too saucy for me, but that probably varies and I don't mind it too much so I would definitely order this again. Maybe next time there will be less orange sauce on it and not drenched like this time! 

I am looking forward to coming back and trying more items on the menu. Maybe the wings next time? And the hangover soup if I do a lot of drinking the night before ;)

excerpts: Ordered the Korean Ramen with the spam, the broth was flavorful.
The half half fried chicken was so garlicky and crunchy (must order).
We also got the seafood pancakes to push our appetite to the max.
Also not a disappointment.
korean ramen.author: Justin L.
korean ramen.review: What? A Korean restaurant in the outer Mission!   Totally found this place on accident and so glad we did.  It was definitely authentic and with a modern ambiance.  I hope this place will be around for a long time as we're so close to it.  Thank you for being here.  Ordered the Korean Ramen with the spam, the broth was flavorful.  The half half fried chicken was so garlicky and crunchy (must order).  We also got the seafood pancakes to push our appetite to the max.  Also not a disappointment.

excerpts: I can't wait to come back for more; would love to try their korean ramen and especially the hangover soup that everyone raves about!
korean ramen.author: Kris C.
korean ramen.review:
Delicious!!! I went with a big group, so I was able to try a good portion of their menu.

Favorites!
- Taco trio: love fusion tacos! These were filled with variations of lettuce, kimchi, bulgogi, spicy pork, and a creamy mayo-based sauce to tie everything together. 
- Garlic pork belly BBQ plate: We were debating between this and the galbi, and I'm so happy we went with pork belly! Tender and flavorful, and went well with the lettuce wraps (wish they gave only lettuce, the cabbage included was odd). I enjoyed the mini trio of sides that came with it (kimchi, cucumber, sauce) to enjoy the pork belly+lettuce with. Highly recommend! 
- Seafood pancake: Although I wish it was a tad bit crispier, this was delicious and made for a wonderful appetizer. Dipping sauce was yummy--I wish it came with more!

Others:
- Kimchi cheese: Okay, I LOVE kimchi, but keep in mind that a lot of their dishes already come with kimchi. This dish was kimchi-overkill, especially noting that the majority of our dishes had or came with kimchi. I would pass on this one, and would try their cheese corn instead for some variety.
- Kimchi fried rice: It was good, nothing extraordinary. Standard kimchi fried rice that didn't have any wow factor for me.
- Garlic fried chicken: The garlic is apparently sweetened with combined sugar, but it just tasted (and definitely felt) like raw garlic to me. I would pass on this one.
- Sweet n' spicy fried chicken: If you like a lot of sauce on your wings, then this might be for you! Personally, I would love to try their regular bare fried chicken instead--the meat itself is indeed crispy and juicy!

I can't wait to come back for more; would love to try their korean ramen and especially the hangover soup that everyone raves about!

excerpts: Incredibly disappointed by the Korean ramen.
korean ramen.author: Alvin D.
korean ramen.review:
There have been many chances where I've been able to eat good ramen. This was not one of them.

The quality of the noodles is instant ramen quality. I'm actually quite confident it was instant ramen.

I added cheese. They gave me a single slice of American cheese.

Incredibly disappointed by the Korean ramen.

2 stars overall. One earned for service passing. One for the Taco Trio.

excerpts: They have Korean ramen and a Hangover Soup!
korean ramen.author: Michael C.
korean ramen.review:
A new, modern Korean restaurant in the Excelsior playing bossanova? YES!

I was a bit upset when I saw Goldilocks close. I had recently been there and while it was my third favorite Filipino restaurant in Excelsior, they did introduce me to some new stuff.

My mood changed when I saw the sign on the door saying the new place was Hwaro, a Korean restaurant. Excelsior has Filipino, Japanese, Thai, Laotian, Vietnamese, all types of Chinese. But we don't have Korean. 

Let alone one that serves alcohol.

This week they are going through a soft launch - they don't officially open or have a working credit card until 9/5/16 - but are taking customers. The lunch menu is very different from the dinner, which also explains the large break in between.

When I walked in on a Tuesday, there were a few groups eating - and I do recommend coming here in a group or on a date so you can try more. I sat by myself and spent time on the menu. They have a number of small plates that sound great like the Taco Trio, gyoza, and asparagus because something has to be green. 

There are also big plates which are must shares. Three types of KFC (Korean Fried Chicken), kimchee fried rice, seafood pancakes, tonkatsu. They have Korean ramen and a Hangover Soup! 

I went with the sizzling BBQ eel. I love eel, heck I've had eel fried rice directly across the street. The great waitress warned me it was only 6 pieces but that was enough for tonight. Along with it came some lettuce to make wraps, some banchan, and I ordered a side of rice. It was delicious and it will be hard not to order it again.

Or live out a dream and special order a BBQ eel taco.

After finishing up I got to talk to the two waitresses, the owner Ina jamming out to classic bossanova, and the head chef Ryan. They explained some of the backstory, how they will soon be getting three types of Korean beer (including Hite!), shoju, and wine, and that the neighborhood has welcomed them. 

I really like Hwaro and feel it not only adds a culinary option to Excelsior, but adds a more modern option as well. With Rocks Den, Sushi Raw, and now Hwaro, this part of Excelsior is getting some gentrification. Not white people (says the white person), but more gentrifying for Millenials - modern locations with a modern vibe. I don't want the area to be completely changed - I may actually be addicted to Baby's lumpia - but I like that we are getting options to take groups or dates to. Excelsior isn't only for cheap lunch, and Hwaro helps this.

UPDATE: I came over for lunch and got the sweet and spicy fried chicken bento and the pork belly quesadilla. The bento came with side salad, some of the least greasy japchae I've ever had, two dumplings, rice, kimchi and 4 wings covered in sauce. Ask for extra napkins! I definitely got a lot of sauce on my face/beard. The wings were cooked perfectly, and the sauce was both sweet and spicy. Not bad for the amount of food I got.

But the pork belly quesadilla stole the show! I want one right now. Full of delicious pork belly, kimchi, cheese, sauce, and I want to say butter because it was decadent. Still can't wait to bring people here.

Update 9/18: Took two friends here for dinner to finally get a group dinner going. We got:
-Corn Cheese - basically a skillet filled with sweet corn and mozzarella cheese. Two things I love
-Gyoza - I'm a sucker for dumplings
-Rice Cake Skewers - Because it was my birthday, the owner gave these to us on the house, and explained that growing up in Korea, this was one of her favorite street food snacks. We got two skewers with about 5 rice cakes on top, covered in the sweet and spicy sauce from the chicken wings. If you like sweet and spicy, these are really good, a bit chewy. Glad I got to try these!
-Kimchee Pancake - one of my guests doesn't like seafood, which is why we got this. Turns out he also doesn't like kimchee, SMH. This was delicious.
-Kimchee Fried Rice - yeah, my friend didn't have the best meal, but his loss. This was delicious, spicy fried rice with some seaweed which gives it a really interesting flavor. But man that pork belly is so good.

Oh, and for my return trip I was recommended trying the miso pork belly.

Also they have the cleanest bathroom in Excelsior.

excerpts:
Sweet not spicy

Korean ramen was good too.
korean ramen.author: Ellie M.
korean ramen.review:
Really great food!

Has a nice atmosphere, especially if you want a few drinks with your food.

The food could be spicier, great flavors though.
Yu ke jang: great portion, not a lot of noodles but more beef than most places in SF give.

Dukbokki: could have had more rice noodles, but large helping of cheese and ramen on top. Sweet not spicy

Korean ramen was good too.

Will be going back to try more soon!

excerpts: I ordered the Korean ramen, it is instant ramen yet has a comforting element.
Their kalbi is also very good and they serve you a good portion.
If you are in the area you should definitely stop here.
korean ramen.author: Kayla L.
korean ramen.review: Glad to see a good Korean spot in the excelsior! Very inviting with a wonderful hospitality. The food is also very good and fresh. I ordered the Korean ramen, it is instant ramen yet has a comforting element. Their kalbi is also very good and they serve you a good portion. If you are in the area you should definitely stop here.

excerpts: I had the korean ramen which is basically the ramen that comes in a bag that you can cook yourself at home.
It was ok.
My friend had the korean spicy chicken wings which looked really good
but once you took a bite they were
just ok
i've had better.
The service was probably best part out of the whole experience.
Everyone is very nice.
korean ramen.author: Genelle G.
korean ramen.review: Came here last week had there gyozas  which were alright nothing special. I had the korean ramen which is basically the ramen that comes in a bag that you can cook yourself at home. It was ok. My friend had the korean spicy chicken wings which looked really good but once you took a bite they were just ok i've had better. The service was probably best part out of the whole experience. Everyone is very nice.

excerpts: FYI they have taken the seafood pancake off the menu because the owner is currently sick.
seafood pancake.author: Karen H.
seafood pancake.review:
Yummy Korean food....... but the food served here didn't agree with my boyfriends stomach or mine. Not sure what it was... as I review the health ratings..

We ordered three dishes, and they are listed below :

Galbi - so so good. Everything on the dish including the bed of onions was delicious. I really loved the light char yet the meat was tender and juicy! the smaller portion feeds 2 easily if you order at least a couple more dishes. 

Kimchi pancake - the best kimchi pancake I have had!! I loved how they cut the pancake into smaller portions and each bite was consistent. Kimchi, crunchy pancake, yummmmmm!!!

Chicken wings- don't order original. It's so basic and unflavored. Garlic was super yummy. We ordered half half and they charge $1 more . Not the best wings I've had - the batter is a little thicker and airy here but the chicken is moist, tender. I think the garlic flavor could be a little more deep, it was pretty shallow and only could be tasted on bites with the inconsistently spread garlic sauce.


FYI they have taken the seafood pancake off the menu because the owner is currently sick. It is a labor intensive dish and will not be back until she recovers.

Parking is iffy and the area is too- try to park close!

Otherwise, service was amazing and we would come back should we be convinced it wasn't this food that gave us both issues... but probably not :(

excerpts: We ordered a whole bunch of dishes, which includes bibimbap, kimchi fried rice, seafood pancake, sweet potato fries, and one of each fried chicken (original, garlic, and sweet & spicy).
My favour dishes here are the seafood pancake and fried chicken.
The seafood package is packed with seafood so you get a mouthful with every bit instead of a few pieces here and there.
Fried chicken is crispy and delicious.
Make sure to check in on Yelp for 10% off!
seafood pancake.author: Galen W.
seafood pancake.review:
Came here with a party of approximately 10 on a Saturday night. We ordered a whole bunch of dishes, which includes bibimbap, kimchi fried rice, seafood pancake, sweet potato fries, and one of each fried chicken (original, garlic, and sweet & spicy).

My favour dishes here are the seafood pancake and fried chicken. The seafood package is packed with seafood so you get a mouthful with every bit instead of a few pieces here and there. Fried chicken is crispy and delicious. Make sure to check in on Yelp for 10% off!

excerpts:
The chicken had a nice crunch
Seafood pancake - it felt tasted heavy but it is loaded with seafood.
seafood pancake.author: Toni Rose M.
seafood pancake.review:
Save your money for somewhere better.

I think its overpriced Korean food, but nice addition to my neighborhood. 

I've tried:
Fried chicken - I prefer the sweet spicy over the garlic. I wish th garlic one was more garlicky. The chicken had a nice crunch
Seafood pancake - it felt tasted heavy but it is loaded with seafood.
Bibimbap - tasted bland, nothing special, will not order it again.

Overall - nothing special, I only went here to try it out, I'm not interested in coming back to try the rest of the menu since it did not expect my expectation.

excerpts: Seafood pancake
- This came out on a hot plate.
It was a little burnt but still good.
I think the pancake could have used more seafood
seafood pancake.author: Junella T.
seafood pancake.review:
Hipster meets fusion Korean food.

The decor is your typical SF hipster. Edison bulbs, string lights, and wooden bar. The layout is very "open." There's tables off to the sides, but right in front of the door, there is a random open space.

Fried chicken - We got this in both of the sauces, garlic and sweet-spicy. We couldn't tell which of the sauces we liked better. Both were very very sweet. The garlic wings were topped with lots of garlic that we ended up scraping off the wing before eating. The sweet-spicy could use more balancing. Dish came with pickled daikon. The wings also come out piping hot so be careful when taking the first bite.

Kimchi Fried Rice - This was my favorite. It's like comfort food. The rice was cooked nicely. It had really good flavor. I could kill a whole bowl by myself.

Seafood pancake - This came out on a hot plate. It was a little burnt but still good. I think the pancake could have used more seafood but overall I would order again.

Only complaint is the smell of the place. It has an overpowering bathroom cleaner smell that hits you every once in a while. i'm not sure if it's just an old building or if the pipes are bad, but it's a little distracting when you are trying to eat. 

Will come back to try the meat dishes and soup. Also, if you check in on yelp there's a 10% off coupon.

excerpts: This time we ordered double orders of fried chicken,sweet and spicy fried chicken,seafood pancake, japchae, kalbi and pork belly sizzling BBQ.
The sweet and spicy chicken was more spicy than sweet.
The fried chicken was good
but I prefer a thinner batter.
But the wings were huge!
The seafood pancake was yummy and I loved the kalbi
and it's flavor.
I could have eaten the japchae plate by myself!
Although the pork belly was on a sizzling platter - I want my pork to be crispy!
Ina and her brother Ryan are the perfect hosts.
Our table is always set up just the way we like it!
seafood pancake.author: Donna L.
seafood pancake.review:
We keep coming back to enjoy the food and the company of the gracious host Ina and her brother chef Ryan.  The 12 of us always enjoy our evenings drinking pitchers of beers and numerous bottles of soju. This time we ordered double orders of fried chicken,sweet and spicy fried chicken,seafood pancake, japchae, kalbi and pork belly sizzling BBQ.  The sweet and spicy chicken was more spicy than sweet. The fried chicken was good but I prefer a thinner batter. But the wings were huge!  The seafood pancake was yummy and I loved the kalbi and it's flavor.  I could have eaten the japchae plate by myself!  Although the pork belly was on a sizzling platter - I want my pork to be crispy!  Ina and her brother Ryan are the perfect hosts. Our table is always set up just the way we like it!  And they don't even mind that we are so loud. 

And for all the dishes we ordered and alcohol we consumed - when we got the check - it wasn't that much per person. So that's my hot tip -bring a bunch of friends so you can share dishes and try everything!   We will be back to try that cheese corn and hangover soup!

excerpts: The menu has many items that sounded great and we settled on the taco trio, seafood pancake, and the garlic pork belly bbq.
The food packed a flavorful punch and I would say my favorite dish was the garlic bbq pork belly.
It was more garlic intensive than I was expecting which was great since I love garlic.
I thought the seafood pancake could have been better.
We also had mochi for dessert and they offered six flavors that night.
seafood pancake.author: Maya S.
seafood pancake.review:
Our waitress was awesome in walking through the menu and giving us recommendations. She checked on us frequently however towards the end of the meal, it took a while to get the check. 

The menu has many items that sounded great and we settled on the taco trio, seafood pancake, and the garlic pork belly bbq. The food packed a flavorful punch and I would say my favorite dish was the garlic bbq pork belly. It was more garlic intensive than I was expecting which was great since I love garlic. I thought the seafood pancake could have been better. We also had mochi for dessert and they offered six flavors that night. I'd like to come back and try more items including their soups and the dessert korean pancake. 

It's a very modern space. While I was dining, I was trying to recall what was the restaurant previously and I remembered it was a Goldilock's. Hwaro seems like a great addition to the area.

excerpts:
Seafood pancake (4/5)
4.

Hot stone bowl ramen with spam (4/5)
5.

Half-half wings (4/5)
6.

Kimchi Jiggae (kimchi stew) (5/5)
7.
seafood pancake.author: Su Lin Y.
seafood pancake.review:
This just might be my new favorite Korean restaurant in San Francisco! I used to frequent 707 Sutter and Cocobang but this place definitely hit the spot.

I've been pretty disappointed by corn cheeses at other Korean places around here but THIS was so good. Previous corn cheeses just left me thinking: "I could do this better on a random skillet with string cheese at home". But this one--we wiped it out in a few minutes. The corn wasn't too soggy or mushy, with a generous serving of cheese, and topped with tempura crunch, which was actually an amazing addition. 

We were a table of 4 but ordered SO much even the waiter thought we over-ordered. But with eyes significantly bigger than our bellies, we were prepared for take-out.

We ordered:
1. Topokki with cheese (4/5 stars)
2. Kalbi (5/5)
3. Seafood pancake (4/5)
4. Hot stone bowl ramen with spam (4/5)
5. Half-half wings (4/5)
6. Kimchi Jiggae (kimchi stew) (5/5)
7. Corn cheese (5/5)
8. Taco trio (5/5) (if you're sharing this... GRAB THE BULGOGI PIECE FAST) 

The portions were really generous so much so that we had to drag an extra table over to put all the food (we eventually also filled that table). Kalbi came with super fresh lettuce and all the necessary additive sauces and pastes. I loved everything and went home with my Korean craving cured and a very happy belly. I'll be back!!!!

excerpts: The seafood pancake was quite generous in portion size.
It could have more protein inside the carb, but it was cooked well.
seafood pancake.author: Byron H.
seafood pancake.review: I had the kimchee fried rice and found it to be a solid entree. The fried egg, kimchee, and seaweed went well together. The seafood pancake was quite generous in portion size. It could have more protein inside the carb, but it was cooked well.

excerpts: Seafood Pancake: I would've liked it a bit crunchier, but they do give a very generous portion of seafood.
seafood pancake.author: Carolyn L.
seafood pancake.review:
I was surprised at how delicious this was! I'm not a huge fan of fusion menus, but the dishes here tasted great. The interior has a very modern, hipster flair but the food tastes authentic. One downside is that dishes are pricey and you don't get the typical authentic complimentary side dishes. But some main dishes come with a tiny side of kimchee and pickled cucumbers. 

Bulgogi: really really good! Juicy, flavorful, not too fatty, and fantastic miso dipping sauce. 

Taco Trio: love the different varieties of meat in the taco and the kimchee! Flavors worked well with the tortilla. 

Seafood Pancake: I would've liked it a bit crunchier, but they do give a very generous portion of seafood. 

Kimchee Fried Rice: delicious and very flavorful. Highly recommend!

excerpts:
Seafood Pancake w/ shrimp, squid, chives ($14) - 2 STARS
bit.ly/2dDYfJb
The pajeon wasn't thoroughly browned and there was too much batter
so it was doughy.
Squid was chewy and there weren't any shrimp as per the menu.
seafood pancake.author: Cherylynn N.
seafood pancake.review:
3.5 STARS

The Excelsior is an under the radar neighborhood in San Francisco. If you're not a native San Franciscan, you've probably only heard of the area because of Joe's Cable Car Restaurant (now defunct) that was featured on The Food Network. Good riddens with your $20 crappy burger served on a plastic plate, $7 sharing fee, and side of stank face. 

Aside from awesome taquerias, Excelsior's food scene is non-existent until Hwaro soft opened a month ago. The menu is a mix of traditional and fusion Korean dishes (from Kimchi Jjigae to Korean Tacos). Prices are reasonable for SF standards and portions were generous. It's currently BYOB until they get their liquor license so definitely stop by Kukje beforehand and bring in soju and beer. Reservations accepted. 

~ * ~ F O O D ~ * ~
The banchans: kimchi  and cucumber salad were weak which is usually a bad sign for a Korean restaurant but the food turned out pretty decent. I like that they provide you with lettuce wraps upon request and they have purple rice (yay!) but they charge you $2/bowl bit.ly/2dE0nkp. 

*Kalbi: Marinated Beef Short-Ribs (LA cut) w/ banchan, lettuce for wrapping ($25) - 4.5 STARS
bit.ly/2dC2mjY
The table's favorite, the Kalbi was perfectly marinated and grilled. Each savory sweet piece was nicely charred, marbled, and very tender. On par with the Kalbi I've had in the South Bay. 

*Taco Trio w/ bulgogi, spicy pork belly, kimchi, lettuce ($8) - 4 STARS
bit.ly/2dp8cqL
A really good value since there were generous amount of tender bulgogi and pork belly but the marinades were both sweet. A wedge of lime would have been perfect to cut through all the sweetness. 

*Korean Fried Chicken: Half Garlic, Half Sweet-Spicy ($16) - 3.5 STARS
bit.ly/2cNwLL7
We requested half regular and half sweet spicy but received the garlic instead of the regular. The KFC batter is thick and crunchy and the chicken was moist and juicy. It was underseasoned but I prefer that over it being overly salty. The garlic mixture was raw, minced garlic and sugar. It was unappetizingly astringent and cloyingly sweet so we scraped it off. I didn't try the sweet spicy one. Accompanying pickled daikon was great - crunchy and nicely pickled.

Kimchi Fried Rice w/ pork, sunny-side up egg, seaweed ($12) - 3.5 STARS
bit.ly/2d8MMw4
The fried rice was on the bland side since the kimchi was mild and not very fermented, but the perfectly cooked egg with an oozy yolk added a nice, creamy "sauce".

Samgyupsal Gui: BBQ Pork Belly, spicy sauce ($19) - 3 STARS
bit.ly/2cXBRIb
It was a pretty large portion of pork belly but it was chewy and the "spicy" sauce was more sweet than spicy. 

*Haemul Pajeon: Seafood Pancake w/ shrimp, squid, chives ($14) - 2 STARS
bit.ly/2dDYfJb
The pajeon wasn't thoroughly browned and there was too much batter so it was doughy. Squid was chewy and there weren't any shrimp as per the menu. Dipping sauce (soy-vinegar) was good though. 

Kimchi Jjigae: Kimchi Soup w/ tofu, veggies, pork belly ($12)
bit.ly/2dL7k2x
I didn't try any but my friends seemed to enjoy it. 

~ * ~ S E R V I C E ~ * ~
All the servers were green but very upbeat, friendly, and attentive (kept our water glasses full). I brought a birthday cake as a surprise for the birthday girl and the server asked the birthday girl, "Did you want me to bring out your cake, or did you want to save it for another time?" 

FAIL.  

Understandably mistakes happen but going forward, they should pull aside the customer who brought the cake or wait until the customer asks for it. 

Since it was a busy Saturday night and there was a constant flow of customers, it would have been nice if the owner was proactive, pitched in with her staff and/or interacted with customers. Instead, she was having a full, sit down meal with her dining companion at the bar for the majority of time we were there (2.5 hours). Obviously, her restaurant, her rules but it came off unprofessional.

~ * ~ A M B I A N C E / D E C O R ~ * ~
The space is minimalist and hipster. Good for parties of 2-4 and there's two communal tables that fit 6 people each. When we arrived, the ambiance was very upbeat and lively with the pop music that was playing...just as any fun Korean restaurant should be (like Playground, Tonight, The Spot, and Toyose). 

The music soon turned into odd mix of slow, depressing jazz tracks when the owner started having dinner at the bar. Since the music was dampening the mood, my friend's bf kindly provided feedback to one of the servers. She spoke with the owner who changed it for half a track, then changed it back to the slow, jazz music, and returned to dinner with her dining companion at the bar. Again, her restaurant, her rules but she didn't seem receptive to feedback which is unfortunate. 

~ * ~ P A R K I N G ~ * ~ 
Difficult street parking. 

Hwaro is the first and only Korean restaurant in the area serving pretty solid food. Hopefully, they'll pave the way for more restaurants like this to open in the area!

excerpts: - Seafood pancake
: Although I wish it was a tad bit crispier, this was delicious and made for a wonderful appetizer.
seafood pancake.author: Kris C.
seafood pancake.review:
Delicious!!! I went with a big group, so I was able to try a good portion of their menu.

Favorites!
- Taco trio: love fusion tacos! These were filled with variations of lettuce, kimchi, bulgogi, spicy pork, and a creamy mayo-based sauce to tie everything together. 
- Garlic pork belly BBQ plate: We were debating between this and the galbi, and I'm so happy we went with pork belly! Tender and flavorful, and went well with the lettuce wraps (wish they gave only lettuce, the cabbage included was odd). I enjoyed the mini trio of sides that came with it (kimchi, cucumber, sauce) to enjoy the pork belly+lettuce with. Highly recommend! 
- Seafood pancake: Although I wish it was a tad bit crispier, this was delicious and made for a wonderful appetizer. Dipping sauce was yummy--I wish it came with more!

Others:
- Kimchi cheese: Okay, I LOVE kimchi, but keep in mind that a lot of their dishes already come with kimchi. This dish was kimchi-overkill, especially noting that the majority of our dishes had or came with kimchi. I would pass on this one, and would try their cheese corn instead for some variety.
- Kimchi fried rice: It was good, nothing extraordinary. Standard kimchi fried rice that didn't have any wow factor for me.
- Garlic fried chicken: The garlic is apparently sweetened with combined sugar, but it just tasted (and definitely felt) like raw garlic to me. I would pass on this one.
- Sweet n' spicy fried chicken: If you like a lot of sauce on your wings, then this might be for you! Personally, I would love to try their regular bare fried chicken instead--the meat itself is indeed crispy and juicy!

I can't wait to come back for more; would love to try their korean ramen and especially the hangover soup that everyone raves about!

excerpts: Also recommend the getting 1/2 original, 1/2 garlic fried chicken and seafood pancake.
seafood pancake.author: Chad L.
seafood pancake.review: Best kalbi in the Bay Area. Also recommend the getting 1/2 original, 1/2 garlic fried chicken and seafood pancake.

excerpts:
Based on the food we DID receive...
- Japchae topped with Bulgogi was pretty good 
- Seafood pancake was flavorless, not crispy enough and too doughy
seafood pancake.author: Eva H.
seafood pancake.review:
First time coming here, it's Valentine's day. Thought we give this place a try since we live up the hill from here. (Support the neighborly restaurant)

2 Stars because we waited over 45 minutes for our food. Other half of our food never came where we just cancelled overall and asked for the check. Waited another 5-7minutes, but at this point we just wanted to leave. Husband had to go up to the register to pay, he waited in line for another 3-4minutes (since it was a long line of TO GO DELIVERY ORDERS. Took us a grand total of 1hr and 40 minutes at the restaurant, not intentionally.

Based on the food we DID receive...
- Japchae topped with Bulgogi was pretty good 
- Seafood pancake was flavorless, not crispy enough and too doughy 

We had originally also ordered Fried Chicken, half original half sweet spicy. And a side of rice.

Unfortunately we won't be back, at least not until they get their system together. Plus everything was kind of on the pricier side. The overall experience didn't feel very comfortable because you can feel how overwhelm everyone was, customers and employees and the owner.

Plus, the tables were places SO closed to each other we can hear our neighbors convos and vice versa.

excerpts: The food was pretty good, especially the bulgolgi, but I would skip on the seafood pancake.
It was pretty dry, overall it was a great place to chill after work and have a nice hat with friends.
seafood pancake.author: Martina L.
seafood pancake.review: This is a super cute place hat not many would notice, though it's in a weird neighborhood, the restaurant vibe makes it classier and more elegant. The food was pretty good, especially the bulgolgi, but I would skip on the seafood pancake. It was pretty dry, overall it was a great place to chill after work and have a nice hat with friends.

excerpts:
The redeeming seafood pancake:
The only reason why I am giving them 3 stars, the sauce was spot on.
The pancake was light, crunchy and with plenty of ingredients in there.
The calamari legs in there was soft and juicy, the cabbage added a nice texture to the light and fluffy pancake.
Thumps up all the way.
The other dishes that my friends order weren't that great either for the price.
Will I go back?
Not likely.
seafood pancake.author: Suzanne L.
seafood pancake.review:
This is a review for their food only.  (Since it seems that they need to work on their services, if I compare the service to a term paper, this would be a very rough draft)
The garlic fried chicken: 
Not your standard korean fried chicken that one would conjure up, this one looks big and crunchy on the outside but juicy on the inside with tons of garlic.  What's wrong with that picture you ask? Chicken is flavorless, the outside coating is like a baggy giant coat hanging on the meat for dear life.  The garlic is plentiful... sounds like a garlic lovers' paradise however this big dollop of mince garlic is as raw as it gets and is somehow mixed with sugar but without any salt. The end result? Plain overpriced flavorless fried chicken that makes you cry tears of garlickyness with a hint of sugar.  (If you really want to order it please bring salt and pepper with you)
The redeeming seafood pancake:
The only reason why I am giving them 3 stars, the sauce was spot on.  The pancake was light, crunchy and with plenty of ingredients in there.  The calamari legs in there was soft and juicy, the cabbage added a nice texture to the light and fluffy pancake.  Thumps up all the way.
The other dishes that my friends order weren't that great either for the price. 
Will I go back? Not likely.

excerpts: We ordered spicy beef soup, spicy squids, and seafood pancake.
Everything is tasty.
seafood pancake.author: Panukarn Y.
seafood pancake.review: I came with my Korean friend and he really love the food here. We ordered spicy beef soup, spicy squids, and seafood pancake. Everything is tasty.

excerpts: We ordered the Korean tacos, cheese corn, seafood pancake and the combo chicken wings (garlic and spicy).

The Korean tacos were good but too much mayo on them (the portions are also very small), the seafood pancake was ok only (not disgusting but not something I would order again), it wasn't crunchy enough, the cheese corn tasted good but the portion was so small, the chicken wings were moist and cooked perfectly but there was barely any flavor on it.
The garlic was basically fried chicken with minced garlic on top, the chili one was fried chicken w/the bottled chili-garlic sauce put on top.
It was the most disappointing thing on the menu.
I can't believe a chef would just put a blob of sauce on top and claim that as dish they found fit to serve at a restaurant.
The best thing was the tacos and the cheese corn but portions are very small.
I wouldn't go back again.
seafood pancake.author: Honey S.
seafood pancake.review: I picked this place to eat based on the high reviews and was pretty disappointed.  I felt hella bad for my friends bc I chose the place.  The place itself is nicely decorated, clean, service was prompt and polite but the food was bleh.  It's more of a white-washed Korean restaurant and my roommate is Korean so maybe I'm spoiled by great tasting Korean food.  We ordered the Korean tacos, cheese corn, seafood pancake and the combo chicken wings (garlic and spicy).  The Korean tacos were good but too much mayo on them (the portions are also very small), the seafood pancake was ok only (not disgusting but not something I would order again), it wasn't crunchy enough, the cheese corn tasted good but the portion was so small, the chicken wings were moist and cooked perfectly but there was barely any flavor on it.  The garlic was basically fried chicken with minced garlic on top, the chili one was fried chicken w/the bottled chili-garlic sauce put on top.  It was the most disappointing thing on the menu.  I can't believe a chef would just put a blob of sauce on top and claim that as dish they found fit to serve at a restaurant.  The best thing was the tacos and the cheese corn but portions are very small.  I wouldn't go back again.

excerpts: We ordered their Sweet and Spicy Fried Chicken and Tteok Bokki (Rice Cake) with Ramen.
The Fried Chicken had a very nice breading and the sauce was not too spicy.
The Tteok Bokki had a similar sauce to the Fried Chicken, but was not as spicy.
We also added ramen to the Tteok Bokki, but the portion of ramen was very small.
The service here was okay for a Friday night with not too many customers.
The service was not very attentive, despite there being two waiters working and three tables occupied in the restaurant.
The waiters actually forgot to bring us our beer.
Overall a good addition to the Excelsior, but the service and portions of the food can be better.
tteok bokki.author: Peter C.
tteok bokki.review: Lived in this area for many years and have not noticed this restaurant until recently when I found it on Yelp. Most likely this restaurant was opened recently, since this area was known for their empty storefronts that sat empty for years. This is literally the only Korean restaurant in the Excelsior. I believe that this restaurant took over the former Goldilocks Bakery space. Walked into the restaurant and noticed the divey and hipster look with a bar on the right that serves beer, wine and soju. We ordered their Sweet and Spicy Fried Chicken and Tteok Bokki (Rice Cake) with Ramen. The Fried Chicken had a very nice breading and the sauce was not too spicy. The Tteok Bokki had a similar sauce to the Fried Chicken, but was not as spicy. We also added ramen to the Tteok Bokki, but the portion of ramen was very small. The service here was okay for a Friday night with not too many customers. The service was not very attentive, despite there being two waiters working and three tables occupied in the restaurant. The waiters actually forgot to bring us our beer. Overall a good addition to the Excelsior, but the service and portions of the food can be better.

excerpts: The kids love the sweet potato fries and corn cheese.
I mean who doesn't like fries and cheese?
The fries were hot and the corn was full of yummy gooey cheese!
We also ordered the Garlic Chicken, Kalbi, Miso Pork Belly, chilled squid salad, Vegetable Basket, japchae, Korean style pancake and the "old" Kimchi.
The house made Kimchi was delicious but the best were the wings.
According to everyone, they were seasoned perfectly and were finger licking good.
My family and friends said they can drink the refreshing citron soju and eat the garlic chicken wings all day!
Being a vegetarian, I ate most of the mushroom japchae and enjoyed the fresh veggie wraps that I made with the veggie basket.
The citron soju was indeed refreshing.
We also tried the peach soju and all of us prefer the citron soju.
For dessert, we had vanilla and Strawberry mochi ice cream and green tea cheesecake.
The service was very attentive and we didn't feel rushed even though the restaurant was full.
It was a scrumptious meal and we'll certainly be back!
potato fries.author: Robert T.
potato fries.review: Hwaro is a relax, modern and hip Korean restaurant with delicious food.  Came here with my family and friends and we really enjoyed ourselves. The kids love the sweet potato fries and corn cheese. I mean who doesn't like fries and cheese? The fries were hot and the corn was full of yummy gooey cheese! We also ordered the Garlic Chicken, Kalbi, Miso Pork Belly, chilled squid salad, Vegetable Basket, japchae, Korean style pancake and the "old" Kimchi. The house made Kimchi was delicious but the best were the wings. According to everyone, they were seasoned perfectly and were finger licking good. My family and friends said they can drink the refreshing citron soju and eat the garlic chicken wings all day!  Being a vegetarian, I ate most of the mushroom japchae and enjoyed the fresh veggie wraps that I made with the veggie basket. The citron soju was indeed refreshing. We also tried the peach soju and all of us prefer the citron soju. For dessert, we had vanilla and Strawberry mochi ice cream and green tea cheesecake. The service was very attentive and we didn't feel rushed even though the restaurant was full. It was a scrumptious meal and we'll certainly be back! We want to try the hangover soup and the Korean ramen.

excerpts: We ordered a whole bunch of dishes, which includes bibimbap, kimchi fried rice, seafood pancake, sweet potato fries, and one of each fried chicken (original, garlic, and sweet & spicy).
My favour dishes here are the seafood pancake and fried chicken.
The seafood package is packed with seafood so you get a mouthful with every bit instead of a few pieces here and there.
Fried chicken is crispy and delicious.
Make sure to check in on Yelp for 10% off!
potato fries.author: Galen W.
potato fries.review:
Came here with a party of approximately 10 on a Saturday night. We ordered a whole bunch of dishes, which includes bibimbap, kimchi fried rice, seafood pancake, sweet potato fries, and one of each fried chicken (original, garlic, and sweet & spicy).

My favour dishes here are the seafood pancake and fried chicken. The seafood package is packed with seafood so you get a mouthful with every bit instead of a few pieces here and there. Fried chicken is crispy and delicious. Make sure to check in on Yelp for 10% off!

excerpts: I enjoyed the fried rice and sweet potato fries.
The one negative is the sweet pancake with ice cream.
The pancake is pretty hard where you can't use a spoon to cut it but a knife.
At lease the green tea ice cream is good.
Overall it's a 3.5 star for food but because the service is really awesome , I give 4 star!
I definitely wouldn't mind coming here for drinks and food again since it's close by our house.
potato fries.author: Christy V.
potato fries.review: Late post: quick early dinner: this place isn't traditional Korean bbq. It's more Americanized Korean restaurant. The food is ok nothing wow. My girl enjoyed the flavor soju and spicy squid dish . I enjoyed the fried rice and sweet potato fries. The one negative is the sweet pancake with ice cream. The pancake is pretty hard where you can't use a spoon to cut it but a knife. At lease the green tea ice cream is good. Overall it's a 3.5 star for food but because the service is really awesome , I give 4 star! I definitely wouldn't mind coming here for drinks and food again since it's close by our house.

excerpts: As we were deciding what to have, the young server gave us a free mini-appetizer of the Sweet Potato Fries with Spicy Mayo
(photo:
http://bit.ly/2pEQzbq).
They weren't deep-fried, but they were tasty with a snap, and we never turn down mayo.
Jamie and I went with splitting three dishes.
The first was the $6 Baby Asparagus with toasted sesame seeds served on a sizzling iron plate (photo: http://bit.ly/2pU6txS).
It was delicious, just not enough of it to satisfy beyond a few bites.
potato fries.author: Ed U.
potato fries.review:
An excursion to the Excelsior has become increasingly rare for Jamie W. and me these days, probably because I currently work across the bay and don't want to deal with navigational complications once I get back to the city. However, we decided to try this place based on a recommendation from a fellow foodie I met in a yoga class. She led me to some cool places like Mozzeria in the Mission, which we really liked (review: http://bit.ly/2pEQQht). I thought parking would be a bear, but surprisingly there were free meters right around the corner on Santa Rosa. Piece of cake. There was just one group of rambunctious guys at a table next to the window, but otherwise it was pretty empty on a Wednesday evening.

The menu was smallish but nicely eclectic even if it was really Korean with a hipster attitude. As we were deciding what to have, the young server gave us a free mini-appetizer of the Sweet Potato Fries with Spicy Mayo (photo: http://bit.ly/2pEQzbq). They weren't deep-fried, but they were tasty with a snap, and we never turn down mayo. Jamie and I went with splitting three dishes. The first was the $6 Baby Asparagus with toasted sesame seeds served on a sizzling iron plate (photo: http://bit.ly/2pU6txS). It was delicious, just not enough of it to satisfy beyond a few bites. Our second dish was the $13 Kimchi Fried Rice with Pork, which was covered with a fried egg and sprinkled with strips of dry seaweed (photo: http://bit.ly/2pEQmYH).

This was good solid comfort food, a bit by-the-numbers but no complaints, especially with the mini-banchan that came with it (photo: http://bit.ly/2pi2EGy). Our main event was the $17 Garlic Fried Chicken, a hearty portion with at least ten drumettes stacked precariously on a hot iron plate and coated in marinated minced garlic (photo: http://bit.ly/2oRqbew). As much as I love garlic, even I thought the minced garlic was excessive and we ended up scraping much of it off to get to the screaming hot poultry. It came with pickled radish cubes which provided some relief from the sticky heat (photo: http://bit.ly/2oNmjg5). They appear to be searching for their bearings a bit, but they're still off to a promising start.

FOOD - 4 stars...edgy, tasty Cal-Korean with a few flaws but a little tweaking will help them
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...blessedly low-key on a weeknight
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...fairly quiet but mostly responsive
TOTAL - 4 stars...modern Korean spot looks out of place in the Excelsior but what the hell

excerpts: We got two sojus, sweet potato fries, japchae with meat on the side, and bibimbap stone pot.
My main issue is the sweet potato fries were COMPLETELY over salted.
They were hard to eat but my friend doesn't like to complain so he ate them all anyways but agreed they were way too salty.
If I was with anyone else I would've sent them back.
It tasted like someone dumped the salt shaker on it.
potato fries.author: Tiffany V.
potato fries.review:
3.5 Stars

This place is sooooooooo cute. I immediately took a million photos of the decor and sent it to everyone I knew. It was pretty dead on a Tuesday and this spot is huge so it looked even emptier. Had originally wanted to go to 7 Mile House but there was absolutely zero parking so I looked super quick on Yelp and realized I had this place bookmarked. 

This place is no longer cash only which is good because we did not have enough cash to cover the bill! We got two sojus, sweet potato fries, japchae with meat on the side, and bibimbap stone pot. 

My main issue is the sweet potato fries were COMPLETELY over salted. They were hard to eat but my friend doesn't like to complain so he ate them all anyways but agreed they were way too salty. If I was with anyone else I would've sent them back. It tasted like someone dumped the salt shaker on it. So sad. 

I also wish they had more vegetarian/pescetarian options. They very easily accommodated me when I asked for the meat on the side of my japchae though which was nice. I let my friend have all of it instead. I think some tofu/shrimp options would be really good. 

Staff here is great. I think I saw the owner there again having a full meal (just like another review said teehee). I love the different kinds of soju and wine they have. Also kind of annoying is they just placed the bottle of soju unopened on our table both times. I rarely see this happen. Its like opening your own bottle of wine or beer. I'm pretty sure its industry standard to open the bottle before serving it. Also I was asking the waiter for flavor suggestions and he hadn't tried any of the flavors so he was blindly suggesting. I think this place def has some kinks but otherwise I will happily come back.

excerpts: We also had some of the best sweet potato fries I've had in a long time, and kimchi tacos!
I'll definitely be back.
potato fries.author: Gaelen X.
potato fries.review: What a great addition to the neighborhood! I'd been meaning to try Hwaro ever since it opened and was glad to find the opportunity to go last weekend. They have two veg main dishes, Bibimbap and Japchae, and multiple sides. My partner and I ordered both and shared them, both were excellent. My only complaint was that the music was too loud. Service was attentive and friendly, and the portions were generous. We also had some of the best sweet potato fries I've had in a long time, and kimchi tacos! I'll definitely be back.

excerpts: Garlic Fried Chicken - my favorite dish!
They put it on a hot plate with garlic on top and you have flip onto the hot dish.
Perfect crunch and flavor and the chicken was super juicy inside.
garlic fried chicken.author: Kristy L.
garlic fried chicken.review:
I thought the food was pretty good. Came her on the 4th of July so there wasnt much of a wait. The server was very attentive and checked in often in how we were doing. Definitely on the pricier side compared to other Korean restaurants in the city and the servings sizes are not huge but just enough to fill you up. 

I tried the following: 
Kimchi fried rice - pretty tasty, not too spicy and more on the sweet side. The seaweed added gives a nice texture and flavor to the rice. 

Grilled asparagus - $6, small serving size, they use baby asparagus and season it with a sweetened soy sauce and season seeds. Good flavor and crunch.  

Garlic Fried Chicken - my favorite dish! They put it on a hot plate with garlic on top and you have flip onto the hot dish. Perfect crunch and flavor and the chicken was super juicy inside. Highly recommend trying! 

Sweet and Spicy Chicken - I can't handle spicy but my bf enjoyed it. Said it had a nice kick and also sweet flavor to contrast.  

Mochi Ice Cream - mango and strawberry $5, they drizzle the mochi with some chocolate and top it with kiwi. Personally prefer the mochi as is without extra sauce. Just tastes like store bought mochi, unfrozen. Probably could skip. 

Overall, solid place. Nice ambience for a date night. Would come again for the wings or order takeout. Be sure to check in on yelp and get the extra 10% off your bill!

As much as I love garlic, even I thought the minced garlic was excessive and we ended up scraping much of it off to get to the screaming hot poultry.
It came with pickled radish cubes which provided some relief from the sticky heat (photo:
http://bit.ly/2oNmjg5).

excerpts: I really like the garlic fried chicken but the pickled garlic seems to take away some of that greatness.
I wish it was either raw or briefly sautéed instead of marinated with sugar.
garlic fried chicken.author: WQ C.
garlic fried chicken.review:
Not a typical Korean restaurant but good tasting food. It's like elevated Korean food. If not mistaken, the owners and cooks are Koreans. 
You can certainly taste this in their Kimchi soup which is spicy and heartwarming! It's accompanied by fluffy purple rice - a good portion dish. 

The half and half fried chicken is served on a hot plate accompanied by some radish and wet towelettes. I really like the garlic fried chicken but the pickled garlic seems to take away some of that greatness. I wish it was either raw or briefly sautéed instead of marinated with sugar. The chicken itself was crunchy and juicy! 

The place is nice and trendy. Wish there were more banchan tho. 

I would order the kimchi soup again!

excerpts: - Garlic fried chicken: The garlic is apparently sweetened with combined sugar, but it just tasted (and definitely felt) like raw garlic to me.
I would pass on this one.
- Sweet n' spicy fried chicken: If you like a lot of sauce on your wings, then this might be for you!
garlic fried chicken.author: Kris C.
garlic fried chicken.review:
Delicious!!! I went with a big group, so I was able to try a good portion of their menu.

Favorites!
- Taco trio: love fusion tacos! These were filled with variations of lettuce, kimchi, bulgogi, spicy pork, and a creamy mayo-based sauce to tie everything together. 
- Garlic pork belly BBQ plate: We were debating between this and the galbi, and I'm so happy we went with pork belly! Tender and flavorful, and went well with the lettuce wraps (wish they gave only lettuce, the cabbage included was odd). I enjoyed the mini trio of sides that came with it (kimchi, cucumber, sauce) to enjoy the pork belly+lettuce with. Highly recommend! 
- Seafood pancake: Although I wish it was a tad bit crispier, this was delicious and made for a wonderful appetizer. Dipping sauce was yummy--I wish it came with more!

Others:
- Kimchi cheese: Okay, I LOVE kimchi, but keep in mind that a lot of their dishes already come with kimchi. This dish was kimchi-overkill, especially noting that the majority of our dishes had or came with kimchi. I would pass on this one, and would try their cheese corn instead for some variety.
- Kimchi fried rice: It was good, nothing extraordinary. Standard kimchi fried rice that didn't have any wow factor for me.
- Garlic fried chicken: The garlic is apparently sweetened with combined sugar, but it just tasted (and definitely felt) like raw garlic to me. I would pass on this one.
- Sweet n' spicy fried chicken: If you like a lot of sauce on your wings, then this might be for you! Personally, I would love to try their regular bare fried chicken instead--the meat itself is indeed crispy and juicy!

I can't wait to come back for more; would love to try their korean ramen and especially the hangover soup that everyone raves about!

excerpts: Also recommend the getting 1/2 original, 1/2 garlic fried chicken and seafood pancake.
garlic fried chicken.author: Chad L.
garlic fried chicken.review: Best kalbi in the Bay Area. Also recommend the getting 1/2 original, 1/2 garlic fried chicken and seafood pancake.

excerpts: For the fried chicken, the garlic fried chicken just had a slab of minced garlic placed right on top.
When I ate it, didn't know it was going to be like that
so I bit right into a huge mouthful of garlic.
It's weird how they just put the garlic all on top in one huge chunk.
As much as I looove garlic, that was mehhhhh.
The sweet spicy flavor on the other hand, was actually really delicious.
For the price and the food, I'd much rather go to another Korean restaurant.
Service wasn't too great either.
However, glad I was able to try this place and unbookmark it.
garlic fried chicken.author: Annie H.
garlic fried chicken.review: Huge restaurant with tons of seating. First time here and probably my last. The sweet potato with mayo that they serve as an appetizer was weird. Such a weird thing to serve, or is it just me who thinks it's odd? My bf and I ordered the kimchi fried rice, japchae, and the half and half spicy chicken wings (garlic fried and sweet spicy). Favorite dish out of the three has to be the kimchi fried rice. Can't go wrong with ordering this usually. However, the japchae was not good at all. I thought it was just me, but shortly after, my bf commented the same. For the fried chicken, the garlic fried chicken just had a slab of minced garlic placed right on top. When I ate it, didn't know it was going to be like that so I bit right into a huge mouthful of garlic. It's weird how they just put the garlic all on top in one huge chunk. As much as I looove garlic, that was mehhhhh. The sweet spicy flavor on the other hand, was actually really delicious. For the price and the food, I'd much rather go to another Korean restaurant. Service wasn't too great either. However, glad I was able to try this place and unbookmark it.

excerpts: (-_^) Garlic Fried Chicken
(http://bit.ly/2bTm5OZ)
"garlic heaven".
garlic fried chicken.author: Dan B.
garlic fried chicken.review:
didn't hear one person laugh the first 15-20 mins* i was in the mzafza. no wonder i'm single - if all those dullazz convos are what dating is, remind me to delete my tinderoni and not even bother getting my own cookie lyon. wait no i do want a cookie lyon.

TL;DR once the chicken's fully cooked this will be one of my #guiltypleasure / #straightfromthegym spots.

NLE;DR only reason i'm not saying 4 stars is too many pieces of pinkish / rawish fried chicken. but i told ms owner #ladiesispimpstoo, and i'm confident their fry game can rectify #soquicksofast.

(-_^) Sweet-Spicy Fried Chicken $8/$16 (http://bit.ly/2btJKEo)
very sweet, not spicy. generous crust

(-_^) Garlic Fried Chicken $8/$16 (http://bit.ly/2bTm5OZ)
"garlic heaven". bigbody crust

(-_^) Taco Trio $8 (http://bit.ly/2btKdqf)
wish other k tacos would learn from these
also wish tortillas warm or lightly toasted

MUSIC likeabossanova, jazz

PATRONS families, coughboringcough dates

SILVERWARE some ikea (that's a good thing)

DECOR classyish yet spacious enough to relax

alcohol and more menu items planned. i'll give them time before returning. but you can bet it'll be on my mind till then. #datnunadoe ;p

*yes i timed it beezys. for your educational benefit.

excerpts: The garlic fried chicken was quite a hit for me.
I loved the flavor and I made it my favorite dish here!
The spice level for the other dishes here were definitely something to warn those who have low tolerance to spicy foods.
Nevertheless, all them were delicious!
garlic fried chicken.author: Natasha R.
garlic fried chicken.review: The food they have here was very good and moderately priced as well. The garlic fried chicken was quite a hit for me. I loved the flavor and I made it my favorite dish here! The spice level for the other dishes here were definitely something to warn those who have low tolerance to spicy foods. Nevertheless, all them were delicious!

excerpts: The garlic fried chicken was amazing!!
The staff was very friendly, and helpful with the menu.
garlic fried chicken.author: Cory T.
garlic fried chicken.review: The garlic fried chicken was amazing!! The staff was very friendly, and helpful with the menu.

excerpts: We got sizzling pork belly, asparagus, King oyster mushroom, hangover soup, and garlic fried chicken!
Every dish is delicious, garlic fried chicken and sizzling pork belly are my favorite.
Service is wonderful, even though they just opened for 1 week(no advertising, not even soft opening yet)
it's already crowded and throughout the night till they close.
I can't wait for the grand opening!!!
Will definitely go back and invite my friends there.
garlic fried chicken.author: Fanny Z.
garlic fried chicken.review:
I'm beyond impressed by everything we ordered tonight!! We got sizzling pork belly, asparagus, King oyster mushroom, hangover soup, and garlic fried chicken! Every dish is delicious, garlic fried chicken and sizzling pork belly are my favorite. Service is wonderful, even though they just opened for 1 week(no advertising, not even soft opening yet) it's already crowded and throughout the night till they close.
I can't wait for the grand opening!!! Will definitely go back and invite my friends there.

excerpts: Garlic Fried Chicken
garlic fried chicken.author: Sylvia C.
garlic fried chicken.review:
New and only korean restaurant in the neighborhood, so I needed to give this place a try. 
Service*****
Attentive waiters and waitress. Was seated upon arrival. 

Yuk Ke Jang *****
Spicy beef noodle soup. Very flavorful. 

Garlic Fried Chicken *****
Fried chicken with a little sweet sauce and lots of minced garlic. 

Kimchi Fried Rice ***
The taste was there, but the rice was too moist.

excerpts:
The garlic fried chicken: 
Not your standard korean fried chicken that one would conjure up, this one looks big and crunchy on the outside but juicy on the inside with tons of garlic.
What's wrong with that picture you ask?
Chicken is flavorless, the outside coating is like a baggy giant coat hanging on the meat for dear life.
The garlic is plentiful... sounds like a garlic lovers' paradise however this big dollop of mince garlic is as raw as it gets and is somehow mixed with sugar but without any salt.
The end result?
Plain overpriced flavorless fried chicken that makes you cry tears of garlickyness with a hint of sugar.
(If you really want to order it please bring salt and pepper with you)
garlic fried chicken.author: Suzanne L.
garlic fried chicken.review:
This is a review for their food only.  (Since it seems that they need to work on their services, if I compare the service to a term paper, this would be a very rough draft)
The garlic fried chicken: 
Not your standard korean fried chicken that one would conjure up, this one looks big and crunchy on the outside but juicy on the inside with tons of garlic.  What's wrong with that picture you ask? Chicken is flavorless, the outside coating is like a baggy giant coat hanging on the meat for dear life.  The garlic is plentiful... sounds like a garlic lovers' paradise however this big dollop of mince garlic is as raw as it gets and is somehow mixed with sugar but without any salt. The end result? Plain overpriced flavorless fried chicken that makes you cry tears of garlickyness with a hint of sugar.  (If you really want to order it please bring salt and pepper with you)
The redeeming seafood pancake:
The only reason why I am giving them 3 stars, the sauce was spot on.  The pancake was light, crunchy and with plenty of ingredients in there.  The calamari legs in there was soft and juicy, the cabbage added a nice texture to the light and fluffy pancake.  Thumps up all the way.
The other dishes that my friends order weren't that great either for the price. 
Will I go back? Not likely.

excerpts: We were very disappointed to learn that they were all out of the Korean fried chicken probably because the table to my right ordered the last bit of fried chicken, did not finish and boxed it up to take home :( , so we ordered the bulgogi beef instead.
bulgogi beef.author: Jenelle L.
bulgogi beef.review:
Food - 4 stars
Ambience - 3.5 stars

We ordered the king mushroom and asparagus for appetizers. Both were delicious. For our main course, I can comment that the BBQ is very well done here. I highly recommend the kalbi short ribs and the eel. Both were incredibly delicious. We were very disappointed to learn that they were all out of the Korean fried chicken probably because the table to my right ordered the last bit of fried chicken, did not finish and boxed it up to take home :( , so we ordered the bulgogi beef instead. I do not recommend that dish, it was quite bland. 

The ambience could be further improved by adding more seating, diming the lights in the dining area and more lighting behind the bar area (current lighting arrangement makes the restaurant seem closed). I recommend this restaurant be attentive to the small details on the walls (for example, the screws on the big knife and fork were very large and visible. 

All in all, I will be back again for another try, and hopefully be able to get my hands on those Korean fried chicken.

excerpts: My girl enjoyed the flavor soju and spicy squid dish .
spicy squid.author: Christy V.
spicy squid.review: Late post: quick early dinner: this place isn't traditional Korean bbq. It's more Americanized Korean restaurant. The food is ok nothing wow. My girl enjoyed the flavor soju and spicy squid dish . I enjoyed the fried rice and sweet potato fries. The one negative is the sweet pancake with ice cream. The pancake is pretty hard where you can't use a spoon to cut it but a knife. At lease the green tea ice cream is good. Overall it's a 3.5 star for food but because the service is really awesome , I give 4 star! I definitely wouldn't mind coming here for drinks and food again since it's close by our house.

excerpts: Our table ordered cheese corn, spicy squid, kalbi, trio tacos, and tteobokki--nothing stood out, and my friends and I left (after spending $70+) feeling hungry.
As I write this review, we're heading to get somewhere else for food.
If you want delicious and satisfying Korean food, just go to a traditional Korean restaurant and do not bother with this "fusion" place.
Oh yeah, this is a small-plate place, and it's true...
their portions are super small and not worth the $$$.

spicy squid.author: glenn w.
spicy squid.review: What a wonderful surprise in the Outer Mission. On a recent trip to Korea I fell in love with the food. So when I returned to S.F. I wanted to experience Korean food with the same authenticity as I encountered in Seoul. Hwaro delivered! The staff was so friendly and knowledgeable. The music was perfect and at just the right level. And then the food, wow! Every dish had honest flavors. I especially liked the  Rice cake Skewers as they brought me back to Korea. The Kimchi Soup will be my goto this winter on cold rainy nights. I also tried the Pork Belly  and Spicy Squid, both were delicious! The big Mushroom was stuffed with super tender and tasty Bulgogi And just when I thought I could not eat another bite, the Seafood  Pancake came out. It was better then the ones I had in Insa-dong. If you are craving authentic and honest Korean food , then this is THE place!

excerpts:
- Grilled eel plate
Comes out with dipping sauce, ginger, and lettuce to make wraps.
Awesome flavor and perfectly cooked.
grilled eel.author: Baek C.
grilled eel.review:
Went there last night and enjoyed the experience/food.

Definitely love having different types of restaurants in the outer mission area. Not many other restaurants besides mexican or chinese food, so korean was a welcome change.

The interior and decor was very unexpected in a good way.  Modern and minimal design with large open space. 

Things we ordered:

- Rice cake skewer
fried/grilled korean rice cake with a sweet spicy sauce.  Texture was great, crunchy outside, gooey inside.  Sauce was nice and balanced.  One thing I would suggest to make it even better is to add some green onion slices in between the rice cakes. Also some sesame seeds on top.  I think that would bring out another level of flavor.

- Grilled eel plate
Comes out with dipping sauce, ginger, and lettuce to make wraps.  Awesome flavor and perfectly cooked.  Highly recommend getting this.

- Garlic and sweet spicy fried chicken
Flavor of the sweet garlic sauce was good.  Sweet and spicy sauce was similar to the one on the rice cake skewers. The chicken is pretty big and filling. The batter is pretty fluffy which makes the chicken look massive.  
Personal preference here, I don't prefer fried chicken with this fluffy kind of tempura batter, wish there was less batter or a different kind, my go to standard for asian chicken wings is at SO.  But with that said, I know others like this style, and the batter/breading was done well.

- Cold bibim buckwheat noodle
Flavor was good and the sauce was nice and balanced.
One suggestion is that it did not come with a hard boiled egg, or a slice of meat, which I think would complete the dish.  Also the portion was pretty small for the price, especially considering that an egg or beef slices were not in the dish.


Overall, I enjoyed the restaurant especially considering it being in the outer mission area. I would give this place 3 1/2 stars, but bumped it up for location, service, and since it only just opened.

Definitely going to come back to see how it progresses, and once they get their liquor/beer/wine license. They have a nice bar setup, and hope they have some nice beers on tap (always goes good with fried chicken).
